Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




¬∑ Work up to 20 hours per week.

¬∑ Earn a competitive rate of pay.

¬∑ Develop your research skills.

¬∑ Avoid the long commute.

¬∑ Work from the comfort of your home office.

¬∑ Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Title: Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero‚Äôs profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how should we prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, VRM, Grading, AMC)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful

Your Heroic Skills


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience with process orchestrators (preferably DBT+Airflow)
Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can‚Äôt wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can‚Äôt wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando‚Äôs Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What We‚Äôre Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English & German speaking Online Data Analyst's for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.







Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German
You must be living in Germany for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany.
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Willingness to learn and adapt to changing guidelines and tasks







Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.







Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary well-being package, encompassing a wealth of well-being resources
Be part of an online community







Payment

Rate of pay per task is inclusive of reading task guidelines. Payment will be issued in accordance with the terms of the contributor agreement upon successful completion of tasks.







What‚Äôs next?

If this sounds like a role you‚Äôd be interested in taking on, please apply below.

https://jobs.telusinternational.com/en_US/careers/PipelineDetail/Online-Data-Quality-Analyst-m-f-d-Germany/21405







Important notice: TELUS International will never request a monetary deposit for any role or project with the company, and our recruitment and sourcing teams only use @telusinternational.com or @telusinternational.ai addresses when emailing candidates. If you are unsure as to whether a job offer is legitimate, please contact us at TI_AICommunitySupport@telusinternational.com for confirmation.

Title: Consumer Insights Specialist
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for an experienced Freelance Consumer Insights Specialist with a passion for understanding consumer behavior and providing actionable insights. As a freelancer, you will enjoy the flexibility to work remotely, managing your schedule while delivering high-quality research that informs our business strategies.

Key Responsibilities:


Consumer Research: Conduct in-depth consumer research to understand behaviors, preferences, and attitudes. Utilize qualitative and quantitative research methods to gather comprehensive data.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret consumer data to uncover key insights. Use statistical software and tools to ensure accurate and reliable results.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports and presentations that effectively communicate consumer insights. Present findings to stakeholders to support decision-making processes.
Behavioral Analysis: Study consumer purchasing patterns and decision-making processes to identify key factors influencing behavior. Provide insights to improve product development, marketing strategies, and customer engagement.
Trend Monitoring: Monitor and analyze consumer trends, emerging behaviors, and market shifts. Provide forecasts and strategic recommendations based on consumer insights.
Collaboration: Work closely with our team to align consumer insights with business objectives. Support the development of marketing campaigns and product strategies.
Project Management: Manage multiple consumer insights projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to quality standards.


Qualifications:


Experience: Entry-Level
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Psychology, Sociology, Business, or a related field. Advanced degree (MBA, Master‚Äôs) preferred.
Skills: Proficiency in research methodologies, data analysis, and statistical software (e.g., SPSS, SAS, R). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to present complex data in a clear and engaging manner.
Interpersonal: Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with our team. Ability to build and maintain relationships with stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: High level of attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting.
Flexibility: Ability to manage your schedule and deliver projects within deadlines.


Benefits:


Competitive project-based compensation.
Flexibility to work remotely and manage your schedule.
Opportunity to work on diverse projects across various markets.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.
Professional development opportunities.


Application Process:

If you are a seasoned consumer insights professional looking for a flexible and rewarding freelance opportunity, we invite you to apply.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.




We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.




Responsibilities




Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.




Required Skills




5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Desirable Skills




Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Show more

  • Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
  • Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
  • Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
  • Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
  • Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.


Required Skills


  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
  • Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
  • Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
  • Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
  • Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
  • Previous experience with AB testing
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
  • Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
  • Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


Desirable Skills


  • Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
  • Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
  • An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Title: (Senior) Data Consultant (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

(Senior) Data Consultant (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE As a Senior Data Consultant at Oetker Digital, you will champion the digital transformation of the Oetker Group by developing and implementing data-driven Marketing, Sales and Brand strategies to improve business performance. Your contributions will foster a data-centric culture and support the organization's strategic objectives.

What You'll Do


Drive the Oetker Group to become more data-driven by implementing appropriate Data & Analytics Solutions, ranging from reporting to advanced analytics-based business optimization, to enhance the growth of the group companies
Play a crucial role in building and implementing an Oetker Group Data & Intelligence Platform in collaboration with the Data & Insights Team
Consult stakeholders by understanding their business processes, goals and needs and translate these into requirements for cross-functional Teams to create suitable Data & Analytics Solutions
Manage Data & Analytics projects end-to-end, from requirements gathering to implementation, continuous usage, and optimization
Work closely with the Business, Marketing, Data Engineering and Data Intelligence Teams to implement and develop new Data & Analytics Solutions
Report directly to the Director Data & Insights and collaborate with him to define the Data (Product) Strategy and Data Project Roadmap



Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


Exceptional consulting, project and stakeholder management skills, with a proven track record of leading impactful consulting projects
Strong ability to understand business processes with a focus on driving business value, demonstrated by delivering business value through Data & Analytics Solutions
Ability to translate business requirements into technical solution requirements and effectively manage technical development teams
Proficiency in explaining complex Data & Analytics Solutions to business stakeholders and fostering a data-driven culture
A product mindset, always aiming to build persistent Data & Analytics Products instead of ad hoc solutions
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
Understanding of the basic underlying technical (e.g. tooling, data pipeline processes, ML Ops etc.) and methodological (statistical modeling, AB testing, machine learning etc.) aspects of Data & Analytics Solutions
Experience in SQL
Ownership, strategic thinking, and planning skills
Fluent in German and English is a must



Nice to have:


Hands-on Data Analytics/Science (advanced statistical/ML modeling in Python, R, etc.) and Data Processes (SQL, Cloud Data Platforms, Docker, Kubernetes, Airflow)
Experience in the FMCG sector



What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year‚Äôs Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child‚Äôs sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to ‚Ç¨1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners

Title: Internship: Data Scientist - Quantitative Investment Research (m/f/d)
Description:
Your Mission

This internship provides you with the opportunity to become part of our Asset Allocation Team with a focus on data science for quantitative investment strategies.

The Asset Allocation Team identifies relative performance opportunities in international multi-asset markets for tactical portfolio decisions. Applying Machine Learning to Asset Pricing problems helps us to discover non-linear relationships between the macroeconomic environment, market sentiment, and systemic risk.

During your internship, you will work closely with our specialists in quant finance and machine learning engineering. Within our supportive team environment you will have the opportunity to take ownership and full end-to-end responsibility.

Your tasks


Work intensively on the development and continuous enhancement of our cutting-edge, ML-based, systematic investment strategies as part of our Asset Allocation Team
Be involved in the further development and implementation (e.g., conducting experiments as well as evaluations) of our hypothesis-driven research agenda along key building blocks (e.g., data, transformations, model(s), targets) relevant for product performance
Work closely with our senior quant finance and machine learning experts
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code in Python


Your Skillset


Currently pursuing a degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or Economics/Finance with quantitative focus
Solid knowledge of data analytics in Python as well as corresponding state-of-the-art tools and frameworks
Experience in working with data, building quantitative models, data-driven decision-making
Strong foundation in or willingness to learn software engineering principles, and a commitment to developing high-quality code that aligns with industry best practices
Proactive and independent workstyle
Strong interpersonal skills and a real passion for working in a team environment
Passion for quantitative investing
Fluent in spoken and written English, good communication skills
Bonus: Proficiency with Git, the distributed version control system that‚Äôs integral to collaborative coding endeavors


Why us?


An exciting and involving role with significant impact on shaping the future of AI-based sustainable investing
A company culture that is based on a spirit of cooperation and is characterized by a high level of quality awareness, openness and attention to detail in all areas of our work
The opportunity to work in an interdisciplinary team with our experienced quant finance, software engineering and machine learning experts
A modern loft office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg, healthy food (including coffee, juices, fruit, vegetables, sandwiches) and high-end hardware from Apple
Internal workshops, unique learning possibilities across a wide range of domains as well as amazing team events
Benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Fitness First as well as corporate benefits


About Us

We are a deep tech pioneer, providing AI-based investment solutions to our clients. Building on the best practices of quantitative asset management we tap the potential of machine learning for sustainable investments on capital market.

Our interdisciplinary team consists of experts in the fields of finance, computer science, software engineering, machine learning as well as mathematics, physics, and neuroscience. Ultramarin is embedded in the global AI community, through a close exchange with leading universities and as a member of Inquire Europe.

To date Ultramarin is one of the leading drivers for AI-based analyses and decision-making processes in asset management. Ultramarin has been founded in 2017, is headquartered in Berlin, with additional locations in Frankfurt and Munich, and is backed by leading international business angels and VCs.

Title: Growth Data Analyst Intern (all genders)
Description:
As Europe's fastest-growing unicorn, we revolutionize eCommerce globally. Through strategic acquisitions, scaling initiatives, and cutting-edge technology, we're the top player in the industry. Following our recent acquisition of Perch - the leading US aggregator - and a successful Series D funding round led by Presight Captial, we‚Äôre aimed toward a $1 billion top-line business!







Your Role




As a Growth Data Analyst Intern on our Organic Growth & Automation Team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Team Lead in both strategic and operational development efforts aimed at enhancing the organic growth of our product portfolio. You will be involved in collaborations with external stakeholders to optimize and expand our reach. A great opportunity to develop and refine your skills in a supportive and innovative environment with a talented team that is building Europe‚Äôs next-generation consumer goods giant!







Your responsibilities will include:




Assisting in the strategic planning and execution of organic growth initiatives to enhance marketplace performance
Utilizing AI and advanced automation tools to ensure product listings for over 40,000 products are optimized to deliver maximum value to consumers, driving sales growth
Leveraging your technical skills to process and analyze data using Excel, SQL, and/or Python, ensuring listings meet the highest standards
Collaborating closely with internal teams and external partners to drive strategic collaborations and partnerships
Maintaining a keen eye for detail to ensure all product listings are accurate, comprehensive, and compelling







Your Profile




To succeed in this role you:




Are currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree from a top-ranking university
Hold strong skills in Excel, SQL,and/or Python
Possess the ability to process and analyze data effectively to drive insights and action
Pay exceptional attention to detail, ensuring high standards are maintained across all tasks
Are Comfortable working with AI tools and advanced automation technologies
Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and is eager to contribute to the growth of a leading e-commerce company
Have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams













About Razor Group




We are revolutionizing the e-commerce world, reaching over $1 billion in value and over $700 million in revenue, with the backing of top investors like Black Rock, VPC, and Fortress, Apollo, 468 Capital, Rocket Internet. Along with Perch and our previous acquisitions of Factory14 in Spain, Valoreo in Latin America, and our German competitor Stryze, we now operate a catalogue of over 40,000 products across 3 continents and 10+ countries. Headquartered in Berlin, we are also present in Austin, Boston, Delhi NCR, Hangzhou, and Mexico City!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have strong background in Data Analysis?




Do you want to apply your skills and grow within a growing market?




We've partnered with a leading supplier of modern and professional learning solutions.




You will analyze large amounts of data to identify trends in their SaaS platform and generate insights. Through these analyses, you will generate insights for their product team and various stakeholders and actively contribute to their data driven product development.




Please apply if you have the following:

A bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
You can record, analyze, develop solutions and master various tools for data analysis and visualization such as Mixpanel or Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills with storytelling and visualization techniques to prepare findings in a way that is appropriate for the target group.
Ideally, you have knowledge of SQL, Python or R.
You have experience with cloud-based data platforms.
You have experience in sales processes and automation and data structures (ideally in Salesforce).
You have experience in an agile environment
6+ years industry experience




Nice to have:

Good communication skills in German and English




This is an urgent position. If the above stands out to you and you feel you are right for the role, please do send in your application/ get in touch with a member of the Big Cloud team as soon as possible. Please be aware, we try to reply to all applications, but we‚Äôre only human, for now! Please bare in-mind, you may only hear from us if you are successful.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We‚Äôre looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to People Analytics Lead you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (‚ÄúFrom Hire to Retire‚Äù)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders

Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. Title: Senior Revenue Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

What makes the Finance team so special is our ‚Äòservice first‚Äô approach to the job - we enjoy creating strong communication loops with the wider business, so that bottlenecks are minimized and that things get done quickly and efficiently.

Everybody is accountable for their own workload and takes pride in being meticulous and precise. We also enjoy learning and developing as we go - it‚Äôs important that you share this approach!

Day-to-day:


Provide support in the implementation of our revenue subledger to scale our revenue accounting to the next level
Work closely with Product, Analytics and Engineering on country rollouts and data validations
Manage cross functional processes with Product, Analytics, Engineering and other Accounting process owners, to collect and implement accounting requirements from the business related to revenue data flow
Perform proactive in-depth accounting analysis, measurement, and reconciliations of key revenue accounts
Prepare deliverables for external audit review and testing, and SOX control documentation for internal audit teams
Detect and resolve data issues and reconciliation gaps
Ad hoc analyses and projects as assigned


Our humble expectations


Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, Data Science or related field
Intermediate/Advanced SQL skills and ability to pull and work with large volumes of transactional data
5-7 years of experience in Accounting/Data Analytics or related field
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with demonstrated understanding of Accounting processes
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience
Experience with Snowflake, NetSuite, Looker preferred
Data-obsessed and unafraid to go down to the lowest level of detail for truth
You are able to balance between attention to detail and swift execution
Experience in the gig economy or marketplace company is a plus
Comfortable using English as a working language
Must be eligible to work in the E.U.


Next Steps

Why you'll love working with us


Continuous learning: Significant growth in a fast-scaling global tech firm.
Competitive compensation: Attractive salary package including stock options.
Flexible environment: Embrace a hybrid work model, blending office presence with flexibility.


If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to: Talent Acquisition Partner - timur.novopashin@wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications coming through email due to GDPR. Make sure to apply through our careers page, and submit your application in English!

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt works together with over 30,000 restaurant and retail partners as well as with over 60,000 courier partners across 27 countries and 210 cities.

Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of seconds, in the customer‚Äôs own language.

In 2020, the Financial Times named us Europe‚Äôs second fastest growing company. We‚Äôre still expanding rapidly and are looking for more talented individuals to join us. If you are passionate about cutting-edge technology, great food, and making an impact in your city, then Wolt just might be for you.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, you‚Äôll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your team‚Äôs focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we‚Äôre building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation ‚Äì translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of data science & analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst or a Strategic role with a strong data component.
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨69,000 - ‚Ç¨93,400 gross per year.

Title: Remote Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a meticulous Remote Data Integrity Analyst to ensure the accuracy and reliability of our data entries into company databases and CRM systems. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to data integrity.

Responsibilities:


Verify and correct data entries for accuracy and completeness.
Conduct regular data audits to ensure data integrity.
Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information responsibly.
Perform regular data backups and digital filing.
Assist with other administrative tasks as required.


Qualifications:


High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in data management is a plus.
Proven experience as a data entry clerk or similar position.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel) and Google Workspace.
Familiarity with data entry software and tools.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace.


Benefits:


Competitive hourly wage.
Flexible working hours.
Opportunity to work from the comfort of your home.
Supportive and collaborative team environment.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst Opportunity

Surrey Based

Hybrid Working ‚Äì x2 days on site/week




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to support various business units in enhancing commercial opportunities and drive insights.




The Data Analyst will be responsible for creating and overseeing commercial analyses across multiple workstreams to aid in business decision-making, proposal development, and growth strategies for both internal and external stakeholders.




Key responsibilities include:




Providing analytical support to influence and execute strategic initiatives.
Building and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders.
Managing, tracking, and reporting across projects.
Understanding and integrating various data sources.
Analyzing complex commercial data and pricing structures and summarizing findings for different audiences.
Conducting scenario modelling and delivering summaries to expedite business decisions.
Performing proactive ad-hoc financial analysis to support business decisions.
Understanding the commercial business model and integrating deals accordingly.
Monitoring and auditing team outputs for accuracy and relevance.




The ideal candidate will have:

Proven analytical skills with attention to detail, capable of deploying automation and standardization.
A proactive approach, strong commercial acumen, resilience, technical ability, and high integrity.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and excellent numeric and analytical skills.
Experience developing and working with complex spreadsheets.
Confidence in making decisions, recommendations, and advising the team.
Commercial finance experience in improving business results and adding value.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to present information clearly and concisely.
The ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

A leading company in the CBD industry is seeking a passionate and motivated Junior Data Analyst to join their innovative team in Central London. This organisation is dedicated to delivering comprehensive CBD products and services, emphasizing sustainable, natural, and organic solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Market Research: Conduct thorough market research to gather and analyze data on industry trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape.
Data Analytics: Perform data collection, cleansing, and analysis to generate actionable insights. Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret complex data sets.
Direct Reporting: Act as a direct report to senior team members, providing accurate and timely data analysis and insights.
Presentation Work: Prepare and deliver clear, concise, and compelling presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, or SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Prior experience in market research or data analytics is a plus.




This position would suit someone who is a recent graduate from a top-tier university with an environmental data background. To apply for this position, please apply with your most up to date CV.

Title: Data Analyst, Operations
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).

Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced Data Analyst, Operations to work with stakeholders across Member Operations and Trust & Safety. The Operations Analytics team is responsible for all metrics related to operations efficiency, cost, and longevity. It provides support with the analytical, data science, and analytics engineering capabilities required to scale reporting, forecasting, and insights around member retention, workforce management, and operational efficiency.

This is a unique opportunity for an analyst who enjoys a dynamic environment of a growing company, has experience in operational analytics and has a passion to make a positive impact on customers and the business whilst contributing to the Bumble Inc.‚Äôs mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have an extensive background in operations analytics at a relevant tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical business problems.

You bring experience of working with complex sources of customer operations, payments and behavioural data. You will be fluent in a range of analytical techniques from data modelling, self-serve analytics, to data science and forecasting as applied to workforce management, abuse moderation, and regulatory reporting, and will have a deep understanding of operations and moderation.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Key Accountabilities


Collaborate with the member operations and trust and safety teams to generate actionable and pragmatic insights and recommendations, automating decision-making where necessary, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
Efficiently present your information to executive stakeholders, effectively select the right visualisation types and abstract technical complexities in accessible business language.
Drive core business insights around cost to serve, average handling time, and other operational efficiencies. Design and build reporting suites relevant to the operational stakeholders using multiple domain areas across cost, operations, and business metrics.
Act as a trusted thought partner in the customer operations domain and collaborate with other areas of analytics and the business to bring to light how product and other customer initiatives impact the member support and trust and safety and vice versa.
You will act as translator between business and analyst requirements and applications to the data model.
You will optimise reporting to reflect consistency in sources of truth, and align stakeholders in your domain on definitions of metrics and dimensions.
You will work closely with your team and stakeholders in operations and trust and safety domain to support them with the most impactful priorities, reduce time to insight, ensure data quality and reliability.
You will work with advanced analytics models and methods across the core levers of operations (including experimentation, ML and automation).


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else financial services/high-data-volume industries.
3+ years experience in commercial/operational analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.
You have experience and knowledge of the operations domain across multiple channels, tools, and understand the tooling/vendor landscape (Zendesk, UnitQ among others) and opportunities for automation introduction of genAi.
You have had experience setting up experimentation (A/B testing), measurement, and data collection.
You have experience in building and deploying ML and statistical models for demand forecasting and segmentation.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
Strong experience with data engineering and data modelling requirements needed to automate reporting and measurement.
You have worked with multiple data visualisation and transformation tools, with preference for DBT, Airflow, Fivetran, and Tableau/Powerbi/Looker or similar.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values.
Engaging , inspiring and clear communicator.
A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.
Deep commercial understanding, and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no where needed.
You can manipulate large datasets, combining data from multiple sources to obtain the required results.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with Python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.You are an expert in SQL and Python and are willing to upskill teams on best practices.
You can break down and explain complex processes, requirements and data pipelines to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You‚Äôll have demonstrable experience in presenting these solutions to your peers.


About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.

Title: CRM Data Analyst, EMEI
Description:
The purpose of the CRM Data Analyst, EMEI role is to contribute to optimizing customer interactions and business growth for the Brand.




The CRM Data Analyst, EMEI will play a crucial role in the Maison to leverage our client data to enhance our customer engagement and ultimately foster loyalty to the Brand.




The successful candidate will analyse client behavioural data, performance metrics, market trends and CRM system performance. They will support on the creation and monitoring of client initiatives to enhance business outcomes and improve client engagement.




They will use this insight to help devise strategies and approaches to target our clients to drive sales and enhance the overall client experience.




This position will partner and collaborate cross functionally, including Retail, Operations, Ecommerce, Product, Communications, Events, Merchandising and Planning and Training functions.




Prior experience in CRM and Luxury Retail is advantageous.




The CRM Analyst, EMEI will report directly to the Planning Director, EMEI with multiple key stakeholder relationships across the region.




Key Responsibilities

Development of CRM Analysis

Assess the need and create new KPIs to be able to allow the teams to learn our customers behaviour

Strategic Analysis: Prepare key analysis for the Brand, including monthly and annual reports for the top management. Utilize BI tools to perform hands-on analysis, delivering customer insights across Retail, ECOM, and Buying & Planning.

Monthly Customer business reports (customer typology & customer category) at various level (region, stores)

Customer behavior analysis with product categories and seasonality

Customer and Transactional cross selling analysis

Reporting and KPIs: Develop custom reporting, dashboards, and identify additional KPIs to drive business decisions.

Close collaboration with central CRM team to contribute in creating centralised reports in powerBI

Create an analytical mindset in the retail and ecommerce teams

Data quality monitoring: Oversee client data for the UK and European region.
Segmentation Optimization: Analyse and challenge existing segmentations.

Analysis of CRM Performance

Collection Launch Support: Provide analytical assistance during collection launches, pop ups and new store openings.

Evaluate the effectiveness of CRM and clientelling campaigns and contribute with ideas for enhancements or improvements.

Customer Insights: Collaborate with Retail and Digital teams to analyse customer behavior and demographics. Identify critical client insights, target groups, and evaluate clientelling, events, and marketing initiatives.

Client Engagement Insights: Support all aspects of Client Engagement by analysing performance, ROI for events, and customer-centric insights.

Skillset

Clear Communication: Translate data research into concise, compelling insights through verbal and visual presentations.
Industry Research: Conduct research on clients and the luxury industry.
Holistic Analysis: Integrate and analyze client data from quantitative and qualitative sources.
Collaboration with Paris HQ: Work with the central team to organise workshops for future reports and any other ad hoc projects to enhance departmental performance.
Creativity and Accuracy: Blend innovative approaches while ensuring report accuracy and consistency.




Attributes

A minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in a similar position
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Excellent command of Power BI
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to travel as needed
Passion for Christian Louboutin and a true ambassador for the brand with strong sense of responsibility
Ideal candidate has work experience in medium sized multinational company or luxury business
Additional language fluency is a plus
Adheres to company policy and confidentiality
Proactively contributes to creating a team atmosphere that is professional, flexible and enjoyable
Exudes a ‚Äúno task is too big or too small‚Äù attitude, with initiative, commitment, reliability, and positivity. Does not accept mediocrity
Versatile; embraces change and is consistently able to develop and adapt to the needs of the business.
Driven to learn and grow
Grasps new concepts quickly, prioritizes efficiently and is organized
Exceptional customer service skills along with transparent and effective interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Strong follow up, follow through and attention to detail to ensure deadlines are met




Our Business:

Christian Louboutin opened his first boutique in Paris in 1992. An artist and craftsman with a true passion for shoes, his designs are unique and instantly recognizable, thanks in part to their signature and now trademarked red lacquered soles. The collections for both men and women combine wit, glamour, elegance and technical proficiency like no other. 2014 welcomed the launched of Christian Louboutin Beaute with its first nail colour, Rouge Louboutin. The collection has continued to diversify since then with the launch of lip in 2015, fragrance in 2016 and more recently a wonderful eye collection in 2017. With an extensive range of collections, Christian Louboutin now counts more than 130 boutiques globally.




Our people are at the heart of our brand. We celebrate individuality and allow the freedom to have responsibility, autonomy and creativity within your role. Our colleagues have in common the passion and dedication to our Brand, and its continued success.




Our Values:

We are down to earth ‚Äì we stand with authenticity, integrity and respect.

We have passion ‚Äì we drive the business with agility and care and we are committed to excellence.

We have happiness in all that we do ‚Äì As a team player, we collaborate with positivity, open-mindedness and fun.

We work with inspiration ‚Äì we envision the future with confidence, creativity and freedom.




If the shoe fits, walk with us‚Ä¶




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

The Maison Christian Louboutin is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to recruitment practices that do not discriminate against any job applicant because of their race, color, gender, age, nationality, culture(s), religion, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. We believe that a culture of diversity and individuality fosters our core values we listed above. So, if you also share this mindset and these values and you dream of coloring your soles red as part of the Louboutin adventure, please join us!




*Please note:

By submitting your CV and application information to Christian Louboutin UK Ltd for the above role, you hereby consent to be contacted by email and/or by telephone in relation to this recruitment process by the HR, Northern Europe Team.

Christian Louboutin UK Ltd respects your privacy and your desire to understand how your information will be handled and used. For more information on our how we collect, use and store your information, please refer to our Privacy Notice: http://eu.christianlouboutin.com/uk_en/policy

Customer Insights: Collaborate with Retail and Digital teams to analyse customer behavior and demographics. Identify critical client insights, target groups, and evaluate clientelling, events, and marketing initiatives.

Client Engagement Insights: Support all aspects of Client Engagement by analysing performance, ROI for events, and customer-centric insights.

Skillset

  • Clear Communication: Translate data research into concise, compelling insights through verbal and visual presentations.
  • Industry Research: Conduct research on clients and the luxury industry.
  • Holistic Analysis: Integrate and analyze client data from quantitative and qualitative sources.
  • Collaboration with Paris HQ: Work with the central team to organise workshops for future reports and any other ad hoc projects to enhance departmental performance.
  • Creativity and Accuracy: Blend innovative approaches while ensuring report accuracy and consistency.


Attributes

  • A minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in a similar position
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent command of Power BI
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to travel as needed
  • Passion for Christian Louboutin and a true ambassador for the brand with strong sense of responsibility
  • Ideal candidate has work experience in medium sized multinational company or luxury business
  • Additional language fluency is a plus
  • Adheres to company policy and confidentiality
  • Proactively contributes to creating a team atmosphere that is professional, flexible and enjoyable
  • Exudes a ‚Äúno task is too big or too small‚Äù attitude, with initiative, commitment, reliability, and positivity. Does not accept mediocrity
  • Versatile; embraces change and is consistently able to develop and adapt to the needs of the business.
  • Driven to learn and grow
  • Grasps new concepts quickly, prioritizes efficiently and is organized
  • Exceptional customer service skills along with transparent and effective interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Strong follow up, follow through and attention to detail to ensure deadlines are met


Our Business:

Christian Louboutin opened his first boutique in Paris in 1992. An artist and craftsman with a true passion for shoes, his designs are unique and instantly recognizable, thanks in part to their signature and now trademarked red lacquered soles. The collections for both men and women combine wit, glamour, elegance and technical proficiency like no other. 2014 welcomed the launched of Christian Louboutin Beaute with its first nail colour, Rouge Louboutin. The collection has continued to diversify since then with the launch of lip in 2015, fragrance in 2016 and more recently a wonderful eye collection in 2017. With an extensive range of collections, Christian Louboutin now counts more than 130 boutiques globally.


Our people are at the heart of our brand. We celebrate individuality and allow the freedom to have responsibility, autonomy and creativity within your role. Our colleagues have in common the passion and dedication to our Brand, and its continued success.


Our Values:

We are down to earth ‚Äì we stand with authenticity, integrity and respect.

We have passion ‚Äì we drive the business with agility and care and we are committed to excellence.

We have happiness in all that we do ‚Äì As a team player, we collaborate with positivity, open-mindedness and fun.

We work with inspiration ‚Äì we envision the future with confidence, creativity and freedom.


If the shoe fits, walk with us‚Ä¶


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

The Maison Christian Louboutin is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to recruitment practices that do not discriminate against any job applicant because of their race, color, gender, age, nationality, culture(s), religion, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. We believe that a culture of diversity and individuality fosters our core values we listed above. So, if you also share this mindset and these values and you dream of coloring your soles red as part of the Louboutin adventure, please join us!


*Please note:

By submitting your CV and application information to Christian Louboutin UK Ltd for the above role, you hereby consent to be contacted by email and/or by telephone in relation to this recruitment process by the HR, Northern Europe Team.

Christian Louboutin UK Ltd respects your privacy and your desire to understand how your information will be handled and used. For more information on our how we collect, use and store your information, please refer to our Privacy Notice: http://eu.christianlouboutin.com/uk_en/policy

Title: Business Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading independent academic and professional publisher, is seeking a Business Data and Reporting Analyst to support their Hybrid and Open Access journals‚Äô editorial function. This role involves developing and delivering analytics and reporting solutions that transform data into actionable insights.




Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Key responsibilities




Implement, manage, maintain, and develop existing reports and dashboards across the Journals Editorial function
Quickly acquire a good understanding of the critical data sources regarding availability, integrity, complexity and ownership to ensure reports and analyses are complete, consistent and understood
Troubleshoot, resolve and drive improvement to existing reporting and data visualisations, with a keen interest in automation
Effectively prioritise and manage multiple data-focused requests through delivery with a high degree of accuracy and on time completion
Help evaluate acquisitions of new third-party data sources and assist in implementing and using these sources to achieve business benefits for Editorial







Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Skills/experience




A proven record of collaborative work with other highly skilled data analysts and data coordinators to produce and present clear reports and data visualisations that are user-friendly and accessible to stakeholders
Data analyst experience and applied critical thinking and analytical skills to solve real-world business problems
Knowledge of the journal publishing industry and an understanding of Open Access business models
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office 365 apps (including advanced skills in Excel and proficiency in Power BI, along with DAX, Power Query, and Excel Power Pivot), SQL, and API integrations
Good relationship management skills and confidence in dealing with people at all levels of the business




A competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package is offered.




Referral Scheme - Telfer Partners offer a referral reward if we fill this vacancy with someone you recommend. You can send us contact details of anyone you would like to recommend to enquiries@telferpartners.com.




Equality Policy - Telfer Partners is committed to upholding a professional and impartial recruitment process. Our Equal Opportunities policy ensures that all job applicants and employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, marital status, race, nationality, religion, age, disability, or union membership status.

Title: Data Analyst (Python)
Description:
About the Company: A great opportunity to join a highly ambitious, London-based, food & drink consultancy on a mission to support our customers with expert data insight. They are one of the leading consultancies in the food and drinks industry, and provide expert consultancy through data and insight, powered by analytical thinking, outstanding expertise, and insights technology. They work with a broad range of clients emerging brands and operators and some of the most renowned businesses.




About the Role: They are looking for a Data Analyst confident in Python, SQL and GitHub to join their growing data team, this is more than a standard data role.




Responsibilities:

Restructure and maintain data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all product trackers and bespoke research.
Implement systems to help the optimization of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich internal data.
Assist in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
Set up and maintenance of automated data processes.
KPI tracking
Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.




Qualifications:

Previous experience working with survey data
Working experience in Python and GitHub a non negotiable
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight / rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Dashboard building
Web analytics and behavioural tracking (i.e., Google Analytics)




Pay range and compensation package:35k-37k

Hybrid: 2 x days in London a week

Title: Graduate Insight Analyst
Description:
Introduction

In this role, you will be working in our B2C function working primarily in the acquisition insights team. This is an excellent opportunity to join a multidisciplinary team of supportive and highly collaborative insights specialists, data scientists and engineers.

You will work across a multitude of projects ranging from supporting monthly reporting, working with senior analysts to deliver insights projects and help analyse test results. You will be part of a team who delivers tangible difference and whose work impacts day to day decision making at The Economist.

We are looking for a candidate who is curious, looking to learn new skills and with an aptitude for insight. Experience working with analytics data or other large data sets using SQL or other languages is advantageous but not essential and candidates looking to develop their technical skills are also welcomed.

Accountabilities


Working closely with senior analysts and other members of the team to deliver insights work to product and marketing stakeholders.
Supporting the team across a variety of different tasks ranging from reporting, to deep dive insights projects and testing.
Collaborating across disciplines by helping to provide technical requirements to data engineers and business analysts.
Become an expert in how The Economist acquires new subscribers and how we can optimise our channels and platforms.
Proactively look for interesting insights and new opportunities.


Experience, Skills And Professional Attributes


Ability to examine data critically to extract meaningful insights
Ability to communicate findings clearly to non-technical colleagues
Experience working with datasets
Some familiarity with analytics systems
A proactive approach to problem solving


The following would also be advantageous but not required:


Experience using SQL for data analysis
Experience working in a digital subscription or online retail business

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




We are excited to invite an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Entry-Level Data Analyst to join our team. Your contributions will play a crucial part in conducting analyses that empower our clients to make well-informed decisions. As a member of our professional and globally diverse team, you'll enjoy a supportive work environment that prioritises work-life balance, offering flexible and remote working options. Join us and take the first step in your data analytics career with a company that values your growth and well-being.




The Role

Collect data on executive and non-executive remuneration from publicly disclosed sources, collaborating with an international team
Help maintain, update, and develop new and existing tools and databases
Ensure excellent data quality and accuracy
Conduct in-depth data analysis and develop intellectual capital based on UK and global insights
Prepare reports and support ad-hoc requests for client and marketing purposes




Qualifications




The Requirements

A natural curiosity and eagerness to learn new skills and fully understand a something down to the last detail
Able to work independently and effectively, but also work collaboratively
Solid Excel and analytical skills
Previous experience in the area of board compensation is a plus
