Title: Technical Data Analyst ‚Äì Fixed Income Technology
Description:
Open Systems Tech is looking for a Technical Data Analyst for one of our financial services clients based out of Mississauga/ON. This is a time sensitive opportunity, please apply ASAP.




Job Title: Technical Data Analyst ‚Äì Fixed Income Technology

Location: Mississauga ‚Äì Hybrid ‚Äì 3 days/week

Term: Long term contract plus extension




Technical Data Analyst will function as the single point of contact for those creating and consuming data within their respected data domain(s). Additionally, they will be driving the dev teams to interact directly with key domain and project stakeholders, other Business Analysts across the organization and relevant SMEs throughout the organization, as necessary. The Analyst will play an active role as the global data representative in design decisions with up/downstream implications, requiring a deep understanding of data architecture implications in Data Warehousing, Kafka, Hadoop, and other Data Services technologies. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, excellent analytical skills and a deep understanding of data quality principles and practices.




Requirements

1. Ability to elicit, document, prioritize, and define business needs and requirements.

2. Understanding of Project Management lifecycle, practices, and methodologies.

3. Prior Experience/Working Knowledge of Flow/sequence diagrams, Visio.

4. Proficiency in SQL and experience with data analysis.

5. Strong data management knowledge w.r.t to ingestion, manipulation, enrichment, consumption, and reporting.

6. 5-8 years of experience working in the Finance and Vendor master data domains, associated elements/processes, involving multiple systems and interdependent data.

7. 5-8 years of experience working in data management with Code mining, Data Mining, Visual data Lineage, System to system Lineage as Information Steward

8. Ability to collaborate with the business and technical subject matter experts to ensure standardization of operational information and execution of enterprise-wide data governance policies and procedures are defined and implemented.




Competencies

1. Strong knowledge and understanding of master data elements and processes per the necessary in-scope data domains, specifically Finance and Vendor.

2. Strong Communication Skills/Able to Persuade/Influence Others at all Organization Levels and the ability to foster lasting partnerships.

3. Ability to translate business requirements into critical data dependencies and requirements. Ability to think beyond their current state (processes, roles, and tools) and work towards an unconstrained, optimized design.

4. Foster lasting relationships across varying organizational levels and business segments with the maturity to interface with all levels of management.

5. Self-starter who welcomes responsibility, along with the ability to thrive in an evolving organization and an ability to bring structure to unstructured situations.

6. Excellent written & verbal communication skills.

Title: Intermediate Data Analyst
Description:
IT Data Analyst Position

Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled and organized IT Data Analyst to join our team. This role focuses on data analysis, business intelligence, and transitioning from legacy BI systems to Power BI. The ideal candidate will be adept at building reports and dashboards that drive business decision-making and performance monitoring, particularly within the Oil & Gas industry.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis And Reporting


Translate business needs into technical specifications.
Design, build, and deploy BI solutions using Power BI and AWS QuickSight.
Create visualizations and reports for various projects.
Develop and execute database queries and conduct thorough analyses.


Business Intelligence


Maintain and support data analytics platforms.
Evaluate and improve existing BI systems.
Support legacy BI environments (SAP Business Objects & Tableau) during the transition to Power BI.
Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting for BI solutions.


Database Management


Develop and maintain the organization's data warehouse design.
Extract and manipulate data using SQL.
Collaborate with teams to integrate systems.


Technical Documentation


Develop and update technical documentation for BI solutions.


Skills And Experience

Technical Proficiency:


2-5 years of experience with BI tools, specifically Power BI, SAP Business Objects, and Tableau.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python is an asset.
Proficiency in data warehouse design (e.g., dimensional modeling) and data mining.


Industry Knowledge


Understanding of the Oil & Gas industry is highly desirable.


Soft Skills


Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Ability to present ideas in business-friendly .
Highly self-motivated with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Enjoys working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Strong customer service and stakeholder management skills.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Demonstrated experience in designing, developing, and deploying BI solutions.
Proven track record of supporting and transitioning legacy BI environments to modern platforms.

Title: Staff Consultant Analysis & Insights
Description:
Company Description

Merkle | Cardinal Path empowers brands to harness their data and activate against it in pursuit of their business goals. Our passionate experts act as an extension of our clients' teams, leveraging their deep knowledge to help brands maximize media and technology on the path toward digital transformation.

Job Description

This role is remote-friendly: Toronto or Vancouver preferred

The Staff Consultant role at Cardinal Path is designed for people who have some exposure to digital analysis or digital business intelligence but really want to grow existing skills and learn new skills. Areas of growth include (but are not limited to) data visualization, data science, customer analysis, and testing strategies. If this is the right role for you, then read on.

You are a natural problem solver and a quick learner. You enjoy working with data because it's like a mystery to be solved. You do not give up easily and you know how to separate the signal from the noise. You also enjoy working with people because you can both listen and translate data into meaningful business actions. You are not afraid to re-work a hypothesis. You finding those actionable insights that make clients want to keep coming back to you.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with industry thought leaders and world class clients. We will teach you our analytic methodologies which will be executed through both automated reporting and ongoing analysis.

Duties & Responsibilities


You will document and critically assess the client's business and analysis questions; develop complex metric guides to answer these client queries
You will grow positive client relationships and trust through strong work and timely responsivity
Understand the infrastructure whereby data is collected, either on a website or via media tools; use debugging tools regularly
You will lead data pull methodology from various web analytics and media analytics tools
You will develop visuals to explain data trends, either via dashboarding or data visualization tools
You will provide deep analysis of data; extract & communicate a 'data story', inclusive of visuals, to answer the client's business needs
You will develop clear, effective, on-the-fly communications in response to client queries
You will manage multiple tasks across multiple projects in a timely manner


This role reports to a Manager.

Qualifications


Bachelor's degree (quantitative field preferred)
2+ years of business analysis focusing on performance optimization
2+ years of continuous work with digital analysis tools, such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Excellent communication skills including verbal, written and data visualization
Very strong skills in Excel and PowerPoint


Additional Information

The salary range for this position is $60,000-$75,000. Actual salary within the salary range will be based on a variety of factors including relevant experience. A range of medical, dental, RRSP, paid time off, and other benefits also are available to all permanent employees.

We know through experience that different perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better results. We aim to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

We are committed to working‚ÄØwith our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact canada.recruitment@dentsu.com or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

A global leader in advancing aviation safety and optimizing operational efficiency through cutting-edge technology is expanding its dynamic team of 40+ professionals. Renowned as a high-tech company and seasoned subject-matter experts in flight data analysis technologies, we are seeking a talented individual to fill the role of DATA ANALYST, SPECIAL PROJECTS.

Duties

As a Data Analyst, you will leverage data science techniques and tools to collect, process, analyze, and visualize extensive datasets. The primary objective of this position is to derive insights and solutions that enhance safety, efficiency, and profitability within the aviation industry. Key responsibilities and tasks for this role include:


Collaborate with domain experts, engineers, and business stakeholders to comprehend aviation industry challenges and objectives, defining data requirements and specifications.
Utilize Python-based tools to acquire, clean, transform, and integrate data from diverse sources, including flight data recorders, air traffic control, weather, navigation, and maintenance systems.
Develop and deploy data products and solutions, such as dashboards, reports, models, or algorithms, to offer actionable insights and recommendations for the aviation sector.
Communicate and present data analysis results and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences, employing data visualization techniques and tools like Bokeh and Power BI.
Conduct research and experiments to explore innovative data sources, methods, and technologies to enhance flight data analysis capabilities.
Present work at conferences and trade shows.
Ensure the security, integrity, and confidentiality of all data and documents.
Maintain a high level of discretion and confidentiality.
Perform other duties as assigned.


If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive innovation in aviation and meet these qualifications, we invite you to join our dynamic team and contribute to shaping the future of aviation safety and efficiency.

Requirements

Qualifications / Experience:


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Physics.
Strong programming skills with detailed experience in Python.
Understanding of aircraft performance and aviation safety principles, or the ability to quickly acquire this knowledge.


Asset


Familiarity with Flight Data Analysis (FDA) principles and applications.
Experience with PowerBi and Bokeh.
Experience with Machine Learning frameworks.
Experience with Sensor Fusion methods.
Familiarity with aircraft data recording systems (A717, A767, etc.).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salary range

The salary range for this position is CAD $38.12 - $54.80 / hour

Come work with us!

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka‚Äôpamux Nations,and is home to six M√©tis Chartered Communities.

Our team of nearly 45,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care. Learn more.

We are currently looking to fill a Full Time opportunity for a Data Analyst at Central City Tower located in Surrey, BC.

Come work with us!

Joining the Fraser Health team offers you opportunities to work in a rapidly growing organization with health professionals who are excellent in their respective fields, career growth and advancement, a competitive compensation package (including four weeks of vacation to start, comprehensive health benefits, and pension plan), and the rewarding opportunity to make a difference every single day in health care.

Fraser Health values diversity in the work force and strives to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring and Trust. Fraser Health‚Äôs hiring practices aspire to ensure all individuals are treated in an inclusive, equitable, and culturally safe manner.

Connect with us!

Connect with us on our Careers social channels where you‚Äôll learn about exciting opportunities, get career tips from our recruiters, and meet some of your future team members! You can also visit us on Indeed and Glassdoor.

Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | X

Detailed Overview

Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for providing data management and analytical support for population and public health surveillance and health assessment functions of the Population Health Observatory. The Data Analyst is a key member of the Population Health Observatory. This Unit directly supports the work of Population and Public Health and other Fraser Health program areas. The Analyst has health authority-wide responsibilities in the area of data collection and synthesis, analysis, interpretation, knowledge translation, and dissemination.

Responsibilities


Assists in the creation, synthesis, and dissemination of population health information to Fraser Health stakeholders for planning and decision-making. Contributes to publications informing population health issues for use by Medical Health Officers and Senior Leadership, Managers, and healthcare providers as well as for use by external partners and for public information.
Performs qualitative and quantitative data analysis using descriptive and statistical methodologies, including use of statistical software (e.g. R, SAS).
Uses GIS software to create, organize and maintain geographic maps; uses cartography, geoprocessing, geocoding, vector and raster mapping, spatial joining, spatial editing, and Python and VBScript coding to conduct geospatial data analysis and create GIS maps; maintains appropriate metadata and documentation to describe maps, spatial analyses and processes and shapefiles; uses GIS maps, geospatial analysis, and spatial epidemiology of disease and its risk factors to assist in public health planning and evaluation, disease surveillance, outbreak investigations, and emergency preparedness.
Supports data collection, analyzes data, interprets results, and prepares regular surveillance reports related but not limited to communicable diseases, chronic conditions, and other adverse health outcomes in populations.
Provides technical advice to the communicable disease nurses, coordinators, and other members of the Public Health and Health Protection teams on data collection, cleaning and analysis to ensure consistency and validity of data.
Participates in the identification and resolution of data quality issues, including identifying and reporting data quality issues, analyzing issues, recommending improvements and implementing new/revised processes. Promotes the use of best practices in data management and data quality.
Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, data cleaning and documentation; develops and maintains data collection and storage systems such as databases and spreadsheets, including designing ad hoc reports; automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools including structured query language (SQL); partners with relevant stakeholders to ensure reporting needs are met for assigned databases.
Identifies and collates population health data from local, regional, and provincial sources.
Works collaboratively with relevant program areas to develop project specific tools and support monitoring and evaluation activities.
Responds to requests for information by performing duties such as extracting, linking, manipulating, analyzing, and summarizing data at the request of internal and external partners. Prepares appropriate communications to stakeholders including reports, oral presentations, written communications suitable for a variety of audiences, and online communication formats.
Fosters and maintains positive, collaborative, and effective interdisciplinary working relationships with Fraser Health internal partners, other health authorities, and provincial partners.
Prepares and maintains supporting documentation such as user guides, data collection procedure manuals, data security policies, and data dictionaries.
Supports system development, enhancement, and maintenance by performing duties such as evaluating existing and emerging data systems and recommend strategies to deliver analytics in an accurate, timely and user-friendly manner.
Maintains current knowledge and technical skills necessary to work effectively as a Data Analyst.
Performs other related duties as assigned.


Qualifications

Education and Experience

Master's degree in Epidemiology, Public Health, Biostatistics, Health Informatics, Health Sciences or other related discipline, plus three (3) years of recent, related technical experience in data management, linkage, analysis, interpretation, and reporting, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

Competencies

Demonstrates the leadership practices of the Fraser Health Leadership Framework of Clear, Caring and Courageous and creates the conditions for people to succeed.

Professional/Technical Capabilities:


Understanding of basic epidemiology and public health surveillance systems.
Knowledge of health data sources and data quality issues.
Demonstrated analytical and statistical skills including ability to find, collect, analyze, and interpret data, use basic statistical concepts, and prepare written reports.
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary, dynamic environment as part of a collaborative and high-functioning team. Foster effective working relationships that promote cooperative goal achievement and contribute to an atmosphere of trust and mutual respect.
Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues to share and develop resources, knowledge and skills in order to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of assessment and surveillance functions.
Demonstrated knowledge of statistical, data management, and data visualization software systems (GIS, R, SAS, SQL, Tableau, Power BI).
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
Show more
HTML:
Salary range

The salary range for this position is CAD $38.12 - $54.80 / hour

Come work with us!

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka‚Äôpamux Nations,and is home to six M√©tis Chartered Communities.

Our team of nearly 45,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care. Learn more.

We are currently looking to fill a Full Time opportunity for a Data Analyst at Central City Tower located in Surrey, BC.

Come work with us!

Joining the Fraser Health team offers you opportunities to work in a rapidly growing organization with health professionals who are excellent in their respective fields, career growth and advancement, a competitive compensation package (including four weeks of vacation to start, comprehensive health benefits, and pension plan), and the rewarding opportunity to make a difference every single day in health care.

Fraser Health values diversity in the work force and strives to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring and Trust. Fraser Health‚Äôs hiring practices aspire to ensure all individuals are treated in an inclusive, equitable, and culturally safe manner.

Connect with us!

Connect with us on our Careers social channels where you‚Äôll learn about exciting opportunities, get career tips from our recruiters, and meet some of your future team members! You can also visit us on Indeed and Glassdoor.

Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | X

Detailed Overview

Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for providing data management and analytical support for population and public health surveillance and health assessment functions of the Population Health Observatory. The Data Analyst is a key member of the Population Health Observatory. This Unit directly supports the work of Population and Public Health and other Fraser Health program areas. The Analyst has health authority-wide responsibilities in the area of data collection and synthesis, analysis, interpretation, knowledge translation, and dissemination.

Responsibilities

  • Assists in the creation, synthesis, and dissemination of population health information to Fraser Health stakeholders for planning and decision-making. Contributes to publications informing population health issues for use by Medical Health Officers and Senior Leadership, Managers, and healthcare providers as well as for use by external partners and for public information.
  • Performs qualitative and quantitative data analysis using descriptive and statistical methodologies, including use of statistical software (e.g. R, SAS).
  • Uses GIS software to create, organize and maintain geographic maps; uses cartography, geoprocessing, geocoding, vector and raster mapping, spatial joining, spatial editing, and Python and VBScript coding to conduct geospatial data analysis and create GIS maps; maintains appropriate metadata and documentation to describe maps, spatial analyses and processes and shapefiles; uses GIS maps, geospatial analysis, and spatial epidemiology of disease and its risk factors to assist in public health planning and evaluation, disease surveillance, outbreak investigations, and emergency preparedness.
  • Supports data collection, analyzes data, interprets results, and prepares regular surveillance reports related but not limited to communicable diseases, chronic conditions, and other adverse health outcomes in populations.
  • Provides technical advice to the communicable disease nurses, coordinators, and other members of the Public Health and Health Protection teams on data collection, cleaning and analysis to ensure consistency and validity of data.
  • Participates in the identification and resolution of data quality issues, including identifying and reporting data quality issues, analyzing issues, recommending improvements and implementing new/revised processes. Promotes the use of best practices in data management and data quality.
  • Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, data cleaning and documentation; develops and maintains data collection and storage systems such as databases and spreadsheets, including designing ad hoc reports; automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools including structured query language (SQL); partners with relevant stakeholders to ensure reporting needs are met for assigned databases.
  • Identifies and collates population health data from local, regional, and provincial sources.
  • Works collaboratively with relevant program areas to develop project specific tools and support monitoring and evaluation activities.
  • Responds to requests for information by performing duties such as extracting, linking, manipulating, analyzing, and summarizing data at the request of internal and external partners. Prepares appropriate communications to stakeholders including reports, oral presentations, written communications suitable for a variety of audiences, and online communication formats.
  • Fosters and maintains positive, collaborative, and effective interdisciplinary working relationships with Fraser Health internal partners, other health authorities, and provincial partners.
  • Prepares and maintains supporting documentation such as user guides, data collection procedure manuals, data security policies, and data dictionaries.
  • Supports system development, enhancement, and maintenance by performing duties such as evaluating existing and emerging data systems and recommend strategies to deliver analytics in an accurate, timely and user-friendly manner.
  • Maintains current knowledge and technical skills necessary to work effectively as a Data Analyst.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Education and Experience

Master's degree in Epidemiology, Public Health, Biostatistics, Health Informatics, Health Sciences or other related discipline, plus three (3) years of recent, related technical experience in data management, linkage, analysis, interpretation, and reporting, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

Competencies

Demonstrates the leadership practices of the Fraser Health Leadership Framework of Clear, Caring and Courageous and creates the conditions for people to succeed.

Professional/Technical Capabilities:

  • Understanding of basic epidemiology and public health surveillance systems.
  • Knowledge of health data sources and data quality issues.
  • Demonstrated analytical and statistical skills including ability to find, collect, analyze, and interpret data, use basic statistical concepts, and prepare written reports.
  • Ability to work in a multidisciplinary, dynamic environment as part of a collaborative and high-functioning team. Foster effective working relationships that promote cooperative goal achievement and contribute to an atmosphere of trust and mutual respect.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues to share and develop resources, knowledge and skills in order to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of assessment and surveillance functions.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of statistical, data management, and data visualization software systems (GIS, R, SAS, SQL, Tableau, Power BI).
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Mother Parkers?
We are one of the largest tea and coffee manufacturers in North America, with a mission to create a better beverage experience for our customers. As a leading customer solutions provider to some of North America‚Äôs largest retailers and foodservice chains, we use state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation to help our customers grow their business and deliver superior products to their clientele. Our team of coffee and tea experts are deeply passionate about what we do, proud of our 100+ years of business success, and excited about building a future with endless possibilities. Come join our team and work among the best, collaborate with high performers, and contribute to challenging work every day!
The Role:
Our Commodities Procurement team is looking for a highly organized and analytical individual to join their team as a Sr Data Analyst. In this role, you will bring best practices and focus on system capability and automation; process development and improvement; refinement of cost analysis and forecasting models; key departmental reporting; and risk management compliance in a fast-moving procurement environment. You will also be responsible for delivering value-added business analytics as well as reporting meaningful financial and operational metrics that lead to insightful, accurate business decision-making and operational efficiencies.
We are looking for someone who has the desire to understand business drivers, initiatives and blockers; has strong organizational and communication skills; and can prioritize work effectively. You will help to elevate the team‚Äôs performance by taking initiative, being persistent and creative, and have a passion for continuous improvement.
What you get to do:

Conduct requirements analysis and translate data into informative and actionable reports, dashboards and KPI's across the Procurement Department.
Maintain and develop new approaches to automate internal and external data retrieval, customer/vendor reporting and operational process.
Interface with cross-functional teams to build centralized/custom data analytics tools to enhance the business process.
Own and develop queries and data visualizations for ad-hoc, recurring, troubleshooting requests and projects. Create exploratory data analysis, reports, dashboards to surface data for different stakeholders.
Through data led analysis, provide insight to optimize long-term cost saving growth and support related strategic initiatives (both ad hoc analytics and on-going reporting).
Coordinate with IT to efficiently perform activities related to integration of data and systems.
Simplify complex analyses and create clear and concise stories to motivate the department and company to make better data-driven decisions.
Prepare presentations on department performance, risk management performance and cost savings initiatives.
Challenge the Procurement Leadership Team on best practices and opportunities.
Build and maintain departmental savings and inventory budget as well as latest estimate models.
What you bring to the role:

Strong understanding of enterprise resource planning (ERP) and supply chain modules including (but not limited to) Master Planning, Procurement and Sourcing and, Inventory Management (preferably in Microsoft AX/D365).
3 years+ of Power Business Intelligence (Power BI) experience working on dashboards and data visualization along with good understanding of BI architecture.
Intermediate knowledge of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and relevant tools is preferred.
Intermediate knowledge of Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization, is preferred.
What we offer you:

Flex hours and the opportunity to work from home.
Competitive Total Rewards package ‚Äì health benefits coverage on day 1, 3 weeks of vacation.
Employee discount program on our coffee and tea products.
Dress for your day ‚Äì when you‚Äôre in the office, come in your jeans, or a business suit if you‚Äôre meeting with a client.

By providing your information to us, you understand and agree to Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee‚Äôs Privacy Policy:https://www.mother-parkers.com/privacy-policy/

While Mother Parkers welcomes all applications, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or search firms. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted.Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LeverageTek is actively seeking a Data Analyst for a 12-month contract with its Ottawa-based customer.




Work Location

Remote




Security Requirement

Must have a Government of Canada Enhanced Reliability Clearance.




Equipment Required

You will be expected to have your own laptop to perform the work. A laptop will not be provided.




Key Tasks

Supporting mainframe decommissioning by retargeting key business processes into existing or new applications
Carry out data analysis activities by evaluating current state, performing data gap analysis and support development of future state data needs
Work closely with key business stakeholders to document current state and requirements, examine data, and evaluate patterns and troubleshoot issues, and provide recommendations on solutions based on data management best practices




Key Qualifications

Well-rounded experience in the whole data lifecycle management and hands-on experience in the following data management domains: dimensional and relational data modeling, data quality, SQL programming (minimum 5 years), ETL development, metadata management and master data management, and business intelligence
Experience with reverse engineering the source to target mapping to gain data insights
Experience refactoring existing SQL code to new/alternate data sources




Qualifications

Experience with Azure Data Platform technologies or other public cloud offerings
Experience with Databricks
Demonstrated experience working with key business stakeholders in areas of Finance, Risk Management and Insurance
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.




Assets

Greater than 5 years of SQL development and refactoring existing SQL
Experience working in an Agile environment/team

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote - Canada)
Description:
Summary

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we‚Äôre a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. All new engineers deploy working code their first week, and we strive to broaden individual impact with support from managers, mentors, and teams. At the end of the day, we‚Äôre all about helping our users, growing as engineers, and having fun in a collaborative environment.

Are you strongly driven by a passion for data analysis, complex problem-solving, and designing business intelligence solutions? As a Business Intelligence Analyst at Yelp, you‚Äôll work with partners and stakeholders across the company ‚Äî including our Executive Leadership, Finance, BizOps, Product, Data Science, Data Engineering, Marketing, and People teams ‚Äî to provide relevant data and visualization for key business decisions.

Yelp's Business Intelligence team is dedicated to empowering Yelp's leadership and analytics teams with trusted and reusable data visualizations, data warehousing products, and BI platform support. The work of our team continuously evolves with the company‚Äôs needs and is critical to Yelp‚Äôs data-driven decision making. We are looking for someone adept at engaging with business partners, who understands their needs, and who is passionate about diving into data, unraveling complexities, and designing business intelligence solutions.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada. We‚Äôd love to have you apply, even if you don‚Äôt feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we‚Äôre looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

What You'll Do


Build relationships with key business partners, lead requirement gathering sessions, analyze source data and systems, and provide feedback on detailed data analysis to guide data-driven decision making.
Become a subject matter expert on Yelp data and share knowledge with Engineering, Product, and other teams to refine business understanding, and identify areas of needed business improvement.
Plan and execute business intelligence/analytics projects by collaborating with business partners, data engineering, and data visualization teams.
Contribute to data strategy for data warehousing, reporting, dashboards, and self-service analytics.
Exercise advanced knowledge of SQL to extract critical information and business value from data spread across multiple databases and data formats.
Provide training and ongoing support to business users on business intelligence products.


What It Takes To Succeed


Ideally 3 years of experience in business intelligence or as a business systems analyst, data analyst/developer or similar role.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau preferred).
Experience documenting business and technical requirements and directly interacting with engineers on business intelligence projects.
Excellent collaboration, communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
Working knowledge of statistics and KPIs (LTV, Churn, etc.).
Advanced SQL skills and experience writing complex queries.
Knowledge and working experience with dimensional data modeling.


What You'll Get


Compensation range is $82,000-230,000 annually. Depending on your role and level, you may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
This opportunity has the option to be fully remote in all locations across Canada.
You can find more information about Yelp's five star benefits here!


Closing

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education ‚Äî and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include ‚ÄúPlaying Well With Others‚Äù and ‚ÄúAuthenticity.‚Äù

We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 1-415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Recruiting and Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Agilus Work Solutions has a client looking for a highly skilled and motivated Sr. Data Engineer to join their team for an initial 6-month contract. This Data Engineer will work closely with data architects and business analysts to ensure data infrastructure is optimized for performance and scalability. The ideal candidate will have experience designing/developing data pipelines to ingest, store, and transform data from a variety of sources, monitoring data quality and performance, and provide troubleshooting when needed and developing data models and algorithms to optimize data architecture.

Responsibilities:

Accelerate data-informed decision-making to transform our product and engineering strategy
Architect scalable date models and build efficient and reliable ETL pipelines to bring data to our core data warehouse
Design and develop highly scalable and reliable data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure smooth data flow and accessibility (Informatica IICS preferred)
Demonstrably deep understanding of SQL and analytical data warehouses (Snowflake preferred)
Professional experience using Python for data processing
Knowledge of and experience with data-related Python packages
Develop and maintain data warehousing and storage solutions to ensure data is stored securely and efficiently.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement data models and data warehouse architecture that supports business needs.
Optimize the performance of our data pipelines and data warehouse by implementing best practices and continuous improvement.
Develop and implement data governance policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy, security, and compliance with industry regulations.
Constantly improve product quality, security, and performance
Understand and implement data engineering best practices
Improve, manage, and teach standards for code maintainability and performance in code submitted and reviewed
Generate architecture recommendations and the ability to implement them
Great communication: Regularly achieve consensus amongst teams
Documentation of the work in Confluence

Requirements:

Minimum of five years of experience as a data engineer focusing on building scalable data pipelines and data warehouses.
Strong proficiency in Snowflake, AWS Cloud, Airflow, Snowpipe, SQL, Unix, Python, and API integrations.
Strong knowledge of data warehousing and modelling concepts, with experience designing and building large-scale data solutions.
Experience developing and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines and data integration solutions.
Strong SQL skills, with experience in performance tuning and optimization of complex queries.
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience developing and maintaining data processing scripts.
Experience in API development and integration with third-party systems.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets and identify trends and insights; think creatively and outside the box.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience with agile development methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban.
Design and optimize the SQL syntax and queries for faster data processing
Dimensional modelling experience is mandatory
Adoption of best development practices for batch processing
Managing all work in Jira, including but not limited to story creation, defect resolution etc
Identifies opportunities for new architectural initiatives and recommends the increased scalability and robustness of platforms and solutions.
Extensive experience in establishing data warehouses/lakes, has solid experience with Cloud-based data storage solutions (AWS S3 specifically).
Good understanding of data-driven system integration (web services and ETL/batch jobs), establishing the organization‚Äôs canonical data models and ability to work with XML and JSON-based data formats.
Experience with description techniques for data architecture and the relationship of data with other architecture domains (e.g. data representations in business and application process models).
Education, Qualifications and Certifications: A university degree in computer science or an approved equivalent combination of education and experience.

  • Knowledge of and experience with data-related Python packages

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement data models and data warehouse architecture that supports business needs.
  • Optimize the performance of our data pipelines and data warehouse by implementing best practices and continuous improvement.
  • Develop and implement data governance policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy, security, and compliance with industry regulations.
  • Constantly improve product quality, security, and performance
  • Understand and implement data engineering best practices
  • Improve, manage, and teach standards for code maintainability and performance in code submitted and reviewed
  • Generate architecture recommendations and the ability to implement them
  • Great communication: Regularly achieve consensus amongst teams
  • Documentation of the work in Confluence

Requirements:

  • Minimum of five years of experience as a data engineer focusing on building scalable data pipelines and data warehouses.
  • Strong proficiency in Snowflake, AWS Cloud, Airflow, Snowpipe, SQL, Unix, Python, and API integrations.
  • Strong knowledge of data warehousing and modelling concepts, with experience designing and building large-scale data solutions.
  • Experience developing and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines and data integration solutions.
  • Strong SQL skills, with experience in performance tuning and optimization of complex queries.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, with experience developing and maintaining data processing scripts.
  • Experience in API development and integration with third-party systems.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets and identify trends and insights; think creatively and outside the box.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Experience with agile development methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban.
  • Design and optimize the SQL syntax and queries for faster data processing
  • Dimensional modelling experience is mandatory
  • Adoption of best development practices for batch processing
  • Managing all work in Jira, including but not limited to story creation, defect resolution etc
  • Identifies opportunities for new architectural initiatives and recommends the increased scalability and robustness of platforms and solutions.
  • Extensive experience in establishing data warehouses/lakes, has solid experience with Cloud-based data storage solutions (AWS S3 specifically).
  • Good understanding of data-driven system integration (web services and ETL/batch jobs), establishing the organization‚Äôs canonical data models and ability to work with XML and JSON-based data formats.
  • Experience with description techniques for data architecture and the relationship of data with other architecture domains (e.g. data representations in business and application process models).
  • Education, Qualifications and Certifications: A university degree in computer science or an approved equivalent combination of education and experience.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst ‚Äì BTO
Description:
JOIN US IN CHARTING A COURSE TO A MORE SUSTAINABLE FUTURE




Join an organization that plays a critical role in Canada‚Äôs economy. At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we focus on doing the incredible work it takes to become the world‚Äôs most sustainable port.




The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is responsible for the stewardship of the Port of Vancouver, Canada‚Äôs largest and most diversified port. Our mandate as a Canada Port Authority, as set out by the Canada Marine Act, is to enable Canada‚Äôs trade objectives, ensuring goods are moved safely and responsibly through the Port of Vancouver. That means providing infrastructure and ensuring the safe and efficient movement of marine traffic and cargo within the port. It also means we carry out reviews of proposed activities and developments on federal port lands and waters to determine whether a project can go ahead without impacts to the environment and community that cannot be mitigated.




We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and sustainability. We believe in creating a workplace that reflects the richness of our community and empowers all employees to reach their full potential.

The business intelligence analyst ‚Äì BTO develops and implements visualizations and dashboards that provide actionable insights to the business. This role uses a blend of creative and technical skills to develop intuitive BI solutions that meet the needs of our users.




What You Do

Collaborate with business units to gather requirements, objectives, and KPIs, understand their reporting, data, and product needs, and identify data dependencies and relationships
Create appropriate datasets, data flows in Microsoft data platform based on the defined information architecture
Design and develop and deploy user-friendly, visually appealing BI dashboards and reports using BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Build and narrate data stories and guide in building PowerPoint decks
Provide technical expertise regarding the unique features and constraints of Power BI and related technologies, including best practice recommendations
Develop documentation, user guides, and training materials to support user adoption and customer service. Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of workflows, addressing user-reported issues
Catalogue, develop and maintain operational reporting, dashboards and scorecards that track organization key metrics




What You Bring

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, computer science, management information systems, or other relevant discipline
Minimum three (3) years of experience working with BI tools or any data-specific role, plus demonstrated experience of database management, data modeling, business intelligence, SQL querying, data warehousing, and online analytical processing (OLAP)
Expertise in tools and systems on MS SQL Server BI Stack, including SSRS and TSQL, Power Query, MDX, Power BI, and DAX is required
Experience in configuration of Microsoft Dynamics and Power Platforms is an asset
Experience in configuring, customizing, and extending Dynamics 365 CRM to meet business needs, including workflows, forms, entities, and plugins is an asset
Strong ability to discern trends and patterns from large amounts of raw data
Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills with the ability to take a thoughtful data driven approach to addressing workforce challenges
Must be able to deal with ambiguity and create processes and structure where it does not currently exist
Ability to maintain utmost confidentiality and work with restricted confidential data
Ability to quickly shape data in reporting and analytics solutions and perform testing to assure report and dashboard accuracy




What We Offer

We offer a robust total rewards package including:

Market-competitive base salaries and variable incentive plan
Generous and inclusive benefits offering including retirement benefits plan
Earned time off program
Paid vacation and personal care leave
Learning, development, and advancement opportunities
Onsite gym with towel service in a national landmark in the heart of Vancouver‚Äôs waterfront
Friendly, unique, and respectful workplace




Location: Vancouver, Canada




Job type: Bargaining Unit, Full-Time, Permanent, Hybrid




Working environment: Normal office conditions. Flexibility to respond to issues during non-working hours as required.




Marine Transportation Security Clearance

This position is required to access restricted areas/information. The incumbent must obtain and maintain a valid Marine Transportation Security Clearance as defined by the Marine Transportation Security Regulations.




This is Canadian-based employment, and it is expected that all employees maintain legal entitlement to work in Canada. Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be subject to background checks, including but not limited to criminal record, credit, and/or reference checks.




At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we are dedicated to employment equity and a workplace reflective of the diversity of our port community. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including women, persons with disabilities, Indigenous peoples, and members of visible minorities. Reasonable accommodation can be provided in the selection process and while working with the port authority. If you require support applying to our openings, please contact us at careers@portvancouver.com.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Our client who oversees the Client Data & Process Re-engineering group in Capital Markets is currently looking for 4 Jr Analysts to join a new team he's building on a one year contract. The team is responsible for Client Outreach, specifically tied to Dodd Frank (CFTC & SEC) including Protocol 1 & 2 and Canadian Rep Letter #1. The purpose of the outreach is to ensure they get signed documentation from their clients tied to this regulation in a timely manner.




On a daily basis, the candidates would be responsible for:

- Managing their inbox

- Use Markit to confirm regulatory data matches

- Performing data entry into RCS for bilateral documents received

- Coordinating and collaborating with Regulatory Operations, Legal, Compliance, and CMS

- Performing searches and investigations on entities using internal source systems such as CDR, Salesforce, TRACS, RVS, ECIF, FMS and CORA

- Cross-train with Corporate Banking Credit team to understand credit processes and systems

- Cross-train with Legal to understand how to validate Dodd Frank (DF) documents and Data

- Engaging Corporate Banking Credit team and Sales Desk for sales coverage and client contact information




Top 3 Must-Have's:

- Data Entry experience

- Capital Markets or Corporate Banking experience

- Proficiency with MS Excel (intermediate), Outlook and MS Word




In-Office Policy:

- During the first few weeks, this role will be 100% in-office during training and onboarding

- After onboarding period is complete, it will be in-office 3 days per week at their Commerce Court location




Full-Time Opportunities:

- There is potential for these roles to turn into full-time positions at the end of the one year contract, pending budget, performance, and head count allocation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Responsibilities


Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities


Requirements


Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc. ), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, Java script, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Responsibilities

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Requirements

  • Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc. ), databases (SQL etc.), programming (XML, Java script, or ETL frameworks)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Title: E-Commerce Data Analyst
Description:
Vivier Pharma is a Canadian Pharmaceutical Skin Care company with over 20 years of experience in the Medical Aesthetic Industry. We are currently looking for an E-Commerce Data Analyst to join our team based out of our Vaudreuil-Dorion head office.




The E-Commerce Data Analyst will be responsible for building dashboards and providing in-depth analytics on the Company‚Äôs B2C business in both Canada and the US. In addition, they will support the Digital Marketing Team with insights about e-commerce sales performance, customer demographics and campaign performance by improving current data analytics to help drive strategic direction and future business decisions. This is a permanent, full time hybrid position.




What we offer




Competitive salary and vacation
Hybrid position - working both in-office and at home
Full benefits, including telemedicine, EAP, Health Care Spending Account and Wellness Account
RRSP company matching contributions
Paid personal/sick days
Free product allowance
Social events and recognition programs
And most importantly‚Ä¶a fun team and great environment to work in!




What you will be responsible for




Dashboards / Benchmarks:

Analyze current methods of reporting data and recommend changes and/or tools to increase reporting efficiency
Develop and maintain e-commerce dashboards for tracking and consolidating data from online activity across various platforms
Build, enhance and run ad hoc and re-occurring reports, to highlight current and historical B2C customer and sales tends
Develop processes to streamline and optimize data analysis




Analysis / Data:

Analyze online sales and website performance data to identify trends, patters, and areas for improvement
Present data analytics to key stakeholders
Manage data sources by ensuring accurate Urchin Tracking Module (UTM) parameters, tracking pixels etc.
Work with agencies on analytics and tracking related to agency led projects
Utilize knowledge and experience to help develop strategic business decisions




What are we looking for




Bachelor‚Äôs or College Degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, Information Technology or equivalent experience
Minimum three (3) years of previous experience in a similar role
Experience in aesthetics/skin care or beauty industry is preferred
Strong understanding of data tracking, UTM parameters and attribution models
Detail oriented, with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
The ability to present data in a clear and concise manner through strong communication
Proficient in digital analytical tools such as Google Analytics
Strong understanding of Shopify/E-commerce platforms, trends and technologies
Proficient in Microsoft Office ‚Äì Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
English language proficiency is required for this job




If you are up for this exciting challenge and want to be part of a winning team, we would like to hear from you!




Vivier Pharma is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Engineering Intern
Description:
At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that‚Äôs not all. Whether we‚Äôre leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada.

Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you.

Reporting to the Leader, Data Engineering - the Data Engineering Intern will play a supporting role in the fulfillment of data requirements, leading value-add analytics and insights that contribute to business efficiencies and growth.

Supporting the Senior Data Engineering Developers, the opportunity will provide further technical development and programming skills, gaining experience working with large datasets, various on-prem and cloud technologies and contributing to Interac's mission of powering and enhancing the digital economy in Canada.

You‚Äôll be responsible for:


Working with internal data and analytics consumers to deliver data from source to target
Monitoring and addressing the data quality issues
Building, automating and/or deploying internal tools to solve problems or improve processes
Generating new ideas, challenging the status quo, taking risks, supporting change, encouraging innovation, and solving problems creatively
Managing deliverables and timelines, negotiating with internal stakeholders to meet relevant project milestones.
Developing feature enhancements for data replication pipelines
Monitoring and driving remediation of data flow issues
Supporting the data pipelines jobs and aggregation executions
Documenting practices, processes and standard
Providing root cause analysis and reduction in data flow issues
Reporting impediments to stake holders
Updating and organizing documentation


You bring:


You are currently enrolled in a university or college program in a relevant discipline, like Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science or similar field
Experience with SQL (any dialect), Python, Jira & Confluence
Ability to articulate complex concepts to communication to written technical documentation
You have great time management and organization, by prioritizing and managing your time to meet deadlines.
Have a since of curiosity and drive to identify opportunities to support internal processes
Have strong analytical and problem skills, to trouble shoot and drive continuous improvement initiatives
Confidence in your ability to communicate verbally in an impactful way
Comfortable with learning and working effectively either independently or with groups across different functions and levels.‚ÄØ
Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following:
Data warehousing concepts
Familiarity with Linux-based systems
Git Fundamentals
PySpark / Distributed Computing
Talend, AWS, Oracle


Workstyle: Hybrid*

Location: Toronto

Term: Sept - December 2024

Duration: Monday - Friday


Must be eligible to work for Interac Corp. in Canada in a Full Time Capacity


PLEASE NOTE: To be eligible for Interac internship roles, you must be currently enrolled in a Canadian post secondary academic institution

Interac requires employees to complete a background check that is completed by one of our service providers. We use this service to complete the following checks:


5-year employment verification;
Canadian criminal record check;
Education verification;
Canadian ID cross-check;
Public safety verification; and
Credit inquiry


How We Work

We know that exceptional people have great ideas and are passionate about their work. Our culture encourages excellence and actively rewards contributions with:

Connection: You‚Äôre surrounded by talented people every day who are driven by their passion of a common goal.

Core Values: They define us. Living them helps us be the best at what we do.

Compensation & Benefits: Pay is driven by individual and corporate performance and we provide a multitude of benefits and perks.

Education: To ensure you are the best at what you do we invest in you
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Remote Work (Website Design Valley)
Description:
About Us

Website Design Valley is a premier web design and development company dedicated to delivering innovative digital solutions. We specialize in creating high-quality websites and comprehensive digital strategies for our clients. As we continue to expand, we are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our remote team.

Job Description

We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to help us interpret and utilize data to drive informed business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, a passion for technology, and the ability to work effectively in a remote team environment.

Key Responsibilities

Collect, organize, and analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights.

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).

Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to support strategic decision-making.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.

Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify opportunities and trends.

Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular audits and validation processes.

Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques.

Qualifications

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.

Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel.

Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote work environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in the web design and development industry.

Knowledge of machine learning and predictive analytics.

Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.

Understanding of marketing analytics and customer segmentation.

What We Offer

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Flexible working hours and remote work environment.

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Collaborative and inclusive company culture.

Health, dental, and vision insurance.

Generous paid time off and holidays.

Hourly pay rate: $30 - $40 CAD per hour, depending on experience and qualifications.

How To Apply

If you are passionate about data analysis and excited about working in a dynamic and innovative environment, we would love to hear from you! Please apply!

Website Design Valley is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Value
Show more

Title: Data Analyst ERP Project (3 Years Contract)
Description:
Requisition ID: 183567

Career Group: Corporate Office Careers

Job Category: Merchandising Strategy

Travel Requirements: 0 - 10%

Job Type: Part-Time

Country: Canada (CA)

Province: Nova Scotia; Alberta; British Columbia; Manitoba; Ontario

City: Stellarton, Mississauga, Toronto, Calgary, Victoria, Winnipeg

Embark on a rewarding career with Sobeys Inc., celebrated among Canada‚Äôs Top 100 employers, where your talents contribute to our commitment to excellence and community impact.

Our family of 128,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better ‚Äì great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.

A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1,600 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawtons Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.

Ready to Make an impact?

Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better ‚Äì great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.

A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawtons Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.

All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.

Here‚Äôs Where You‚Äôll Be Focusing


Work constructively with Project Teams to provide SME and guidance on master data, merchandising and replenishment.
Participate in project meetings for data migration.
Build knowledge on Sobeys Master data within these area‚Äôs ‚Äì store, merchandising and replenishment.
Provide and review project decision impacts and recommendations with Manager and Tower Leads.
Provide detailed knowledge of master data to project team.
Provide analysis to our current master data and Identify areas for cleansing and harmonization.
Create reporting to support the analysis; testing of the reporting
Coordinate data cleansing activities with the business.
Validate cleansing has been completed.
Build a strong relationship with project team.
Provide updates with project team, and manager as required.
Ensure on-time delivery of accountabilities within a project.
Provide data support to technical team.
Review data deliverables within project to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Create scripts for validations of data load to support.
Partner with the project team mates to complete pre load and post load validations of the data.
Contribute to the project planning process.
Participate in project process reviews and requirements gathering to ensure master data impacts are captured Lead data assignments
Attend project meetings
Partner with Merchandising and Replenishment to support in the testing and implementation of new processes effecting data, or which data impacts.
Perform, analyze and provide project analysis and support to the entire project team.


What You Have To Offer


Experience with retail master data
Merchandising or retail store and/or wholesale experience
Troubleshooting experience
Experience with continuous or process improvement
Knowledge of SAP and/or experience with retail data
Must be able to escalate issues to managers when required
Must be able to effectively articulate data teams position within project


At Sobeys we require our teammates to have the ability to adhere to a hybrid work model that requires your presence at one of our office locations at least three days per week. This requirement is integral to our commitment to team collaboration and the overall success of our office culture.

The salary range for this position in British Columbia is $60,666.00 - $83,416.00. We will consider factors such as your working location, work experience and skills as well as internal equity, and market conditions to ensure that you are paid fairly and competitively.

We are committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process.

Title: Business Systems & Data Analyst
Description:
Mattr delivers advanced material technologies and complex manufacturing expertise. Through a portfolio of brands, we offer highly engineered solutions, technology and products to support infrastructure markets worldwide.

Shawflex is the Market Leader and a Trusted Brand in the Electrical Infrastructure industry with a wide variety of wire and cable solutions from common to custom. Our Business Model thrives on our Strong Channel Relationships and Entrepreneurial Culture where we champion in providing unique engineered-to-order product offerings to our customers.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Data & Business Systems Analyst will support the business across a range of process & system improvements & data collection initiatives. The candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for using data to drive business insights. As part of that role, they will support the day-to-day management of reporting and be the business intelligence lead in numerous projects, working cross-functionally with internal stakeholders. They will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, generating insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency.

DUTIES:

DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING


Analyze operational and commercial data and develop insights to drive business decisions, with a focus on financial and manufacturing accounting concepts
Build and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide meaningful insights to stakeholders, with the ability to bridge business processes to the system
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for process improvements and cost savings, and translate them into data-driven solutions
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support business initiatives and strategic projects, with a focus on both high-level and detailed analysis
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, with the ability to bridge business processes to the system and analytical insights


SYSTEMS SUPPORT & EXPANSION


Proactively examine current systems to pinpoint strengths, manage risks and identify weaknesses and support continuous improvement projects
Analyze and troubleshoot ERP & CRM system issues reported by end users
Provide a customer service/consultant type role in meeting directly with internal users to find out their related needs, address pain points
Suggest and propose process improvements through the quality of reporting data
Manage projects related to enhancement and implementation of core business systems
Facilitate and function as a liaison between business and technical units and to design solutions to meet business requirements.
Determine scope and prepare detailed requirements documents for tasks and projects up to high complexity to ensure scope and business requirements are understood and acceptable to all impacted areas


Other Duties


Support the business to ensure division and corporate yearly targets are met.
Participate in continuing professional development by attending workshops, seminars, and conferences to obtain and maintain knowledge and skills related to the work performed
Other ad-hoc projects and duties as assigned


SAFETY


Maintain a safe working environment by aligning with corporate safety rules and regulations, and ensuring a culture of safety
Ensure that the equipment and process operate efficiently and safely


Every worker shall,


Cooperate with their employer for the purposes of protecting the health and safety of themselves as well as other workers either engaged or at the work site where the work is being carried out


Every employer shall, as far as it is reasonably practicable to ensure:


The health and safety of workers and others at the work site
That the workers are aware of their health and safety responsibilities and duties


REQUIREMENTS:


Minimum Bachelor's Degree preferably in Engineering (Industrial, Computer), Business, Math, or similar Analytical Field
Minimum 3 to 5 years of related experience
Strong Analytical and reporting skills
Previous experience in Manufacturing - preferred
Previous experience using SQL, Power BI, Tableau or similar tools.
Previous experience using ERP and CRM systems - preferred
Strong experience using Microsoft Excel


What Mattr Offers


At Mattr, safety comes first! We go the extra mile to ensure our employees are safe and healthy
We understand times have changed and so have we. Mattr offers flexible work arrangements (where possible) to suit your needs
Comprehensive total rewards package that includes competitive salaries, annual incentives, medical benefits, retirement savings plans, paid vacation days, education assistance programs, corporate discounts and more!
Participation in service milestone awards and recognition opportunities
Access to mental health support resources such as our Headversity mental health and wellness platform and free, confidential access to our Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)
Rewarding growth opportunities (may include global career and travel opportunities) supported by personalized training, development and mentoring programs
Commitment to providing a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace environment
We prioritize our Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) values and offer a paid Volunteer Time Off Program, allowing employees an opportunity to support charitable organizations in their communities
Company events, social gatherings and team building activities that promote fun!
We‚Äôre working to create a better world. Join us!


Mattr delivers advanced material technologies and complex manufacturing expertise through brands offering engineered products, technology and solutions to support infrastructure projects & markets world-wide. Mattr brands: Shawflex, DSG-Canusa, Flexpipe, Xerxes and Shawcor.

At Mattr, we have built a true team environment where all employees are empowered to contribute to the success of the company. We want you to join our team!

We thank all applicants for their interest; however we cannot accept telephone calls regarding this position. All recruiting activities are managed via our Recruitment Management System and you must apply via the link below or the posting on our career page at https://careers.mattr.com/ to be considered for this opportunity.
Show more
