  • Analyze and troubleshoot ERP & CRM system issues reported by end users
  • Provide a customer service/consultant type role in meeting directly with internal users to find out their related needs, address pain points
  • Suggest and propose process improvements through the quality of reporting data
  • Manage projects related to enhancement and implementation of core business systems
  • Facilitate and function as a liaison between business and technical units and to design solutions to meet business requirements.
  • Determine scope and prepare detailed requirements documents for tasks and projects up to high complexity to ensure scope and business requirements are understood and acceptable to all impacted areas

Other Duties

  • Support the business to ensure division and corporate yearly targets are met.
  • Participate in continuing professional development by attending workshops, seminars, and conferences to obtain and maintain knowledge and skills related to the work performed
  • Other ad-hoc projects and duties as assigned

SAFETY

  • Maintain a safe working environment by aligning with corporate safety rules and regulations, and ensuring a culture of safety
  • Ensure that the equipment and process operate efficiently and safely

Every worker shall,

  • Cooperate with their employer for the purposes of protecting the health and safety of themselves as well as other workers either engaged or at the work site where the work is being carried out

Every employer shall, as far as it is reasonably practicable to ensure:

  • The health and safety of workers and others at the work site
  • That the workers are aware of their health and safety responsibilities and duties

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum Bachelor's Degree preferably in Engineering (Industrial, Computer), Business, Math, or similar Analytical Field
  • Minimum 3 to 5 years of related experience
  • Strong Analytical and reporting skills
  • Previous experience in Manufacturing - preferred
  • Previous experience using SQL, Power BI, Tableau or similar tools.
  • Previous experience using ERP and CRM systems - preferred
  • Strong experience using Microsoft Excel

What Mattr Offers

  • At Mattr, safety comes first! We go the extra mile to ensure our employees are safe and healthy
  • We understand times have changed and so have we. Mattr offers flexible work arrangements (where possible) to suit your needs
  • Comprehensive total rewards package that includes competitive salaries, annual incentives, medical benefits, retirement savings plans, paid vacation days, education assistance programs, corporate discounts and more!
  • Participation in service milestone awards and recognition opportunities
  • Access to mental health support resources such as our Headversity mental health and wellness platform and free, confidential access to our Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)
  • Rewarding growth opportunities (may include global career and travel opportunities) supported by personalized training, development and mentoring programs
  • Commitment to providing a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace environment
  • We prioritize our Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) values and offer a paid Volunteer Time Off Program, allowing employees an opportunity to support charitable organizations in their communities
  • Company events, social gatherings and team building activities that promote fun!
  • We‚Äôre working to create a better world. Join us!

Mattr delivers advanced material technologies and complex manufacturing expertise through brands offering engineered products, technology and solutions to support infrastructure projects & markets world-wide. Mattr brands: Shawflex, DSG-Canusa, Flexpipe, Xerxes and Shawcor.

At Mattr, we have built a true team environment where all employees are empowered to contribute to the success of the company. We want you to join our team!

We thank all applicants for their interest; however we cannot accept telephone calls regarding this position. All recruiting activities are managed via our Recruitment Management System and you must apply via the link below or the posting on our career page at https://careers.mattr.com/ to be considered for this opportunity.

Title: Remote Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Job Description: Rebel Apparel Inc. is seeking a skilled Remote Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports. Your primary focus will be to develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, and analytics tools that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The ideal candidate will have a strong ability to analyze trends and provide actionable insights to enhance decision-making processes across the organization.

Responsibilities


Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.


Requirements


Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.


Preferred Qualifications


Proven experience working in an e-commerce or retail environment.
Advanced degree in a related field.
Certification in Data Analytics.


Join Rebel Apparel Inc. and help us redefine the future of fashion through data-driven insights and innovation. Apply now to become a part of our passionate team!

Value

Title: SAP Master Data Analyst
Company: Riverside Natural Foods Ltd. (Home of MadeGood)
Description:
Are you hungry to innovate? To do things differently? To work with a company that‚Äôs real, thoughtful and very forward-thinking?

Meet Riverside. We are an organic, ‚Äúbetter for you‚Äù snack company, manufacturing award-winning, nutritious, allergen-free snacks. Your kids know us as MadeGood, tasty school-safe snacks. Your buddies on the go grab our GOOD TO GO delicious and nutritious snacks.

At Riverside, we make delicious snacks that are good in every way. From our ingredients to our manufacturing practices, we‚Äôve raised every bar on every aspect. We‚Äôre friendly and focused on creating foods that are good for you and good to the planet as well. Riverside Natural Foods is B-Corp certified, Triple-Bottom Line, Zero Waste, and Canadian owned and operated.

Come work with a Canadian leader! We value teamwork, humility, respect, ownership, adaptability, grit and fun.

You can learn more about us at www.riversidenaturalfoods.com

The Opportunity:

As a family owned and led company, Riverside Natural Foods (‚ÄúRiverside‚Äù or the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) has the freedom to pursue our founders‚Äô vision of being a values-based and purpose driven food company that puts people first ‚Äì our employees, our consumers, our partners, and our communities. Our purpose of ‚Äúinspiring a healthier and more compassionate world‚Äù starts within our four walls and extends well beyond them to include everyone we can positively impact through our products, our business, and our relationships.

Position Summary:

A key aspect of our BT&T‚Äôs mission is to build and sustain a capable organization for profitable growth; this entails deploying and driving adoption of leading practices as well as effectively leveraging SAP and other enterprise technology. The Master Data Analyst is responsible for managing and maintaining the quality and integrity of master data within the system. This role is crucial for ensuring that data related to business partners, customers, suppliers, and products is accurate and up-to-date. This position will augment the bandwidth of our Master Data team to help with the implementation of SAP Master Data Governance platform as well as perform run-the-business Master Data related activities.

Primary Responsibilities:


Demonstrate and uphold Riverside Natural Food‚Äôs Core Values
Partner with Business Process owners, to provide end-to-end technology solutions implementation and Master Data enablement.
Data Maintenance: Regularly update and maintain master data to ensure accuracy and consistency. This includes using Fiori UI for enriching business data.
Data Governance: Implement data governance practices to consolidate, detect duplicates, and manage data quality. This involves mass processing capabilities to update multiple records at once.
Data Quality Management: Continuously monitor and improve data quality through regular audits and remediation processes.
User Support: Provide support and training to users on master data processes and best practices.
Reporting: Generate and analyze reports on data quality and integrity
Demonstrate OWNERSHIP, confidence, and the ability to make recommendations for selection of appropriate SAP best practices and solutions to meet business requirements effectively
Ensure technical design and delivery align with functional specifications and adhere to quality standards.
Document requirements, develops business process maps, creates project plans and training materials.
Knowledge of and ability to use approved testing methodologies, processes and procedures.
Provide input to data architecture, security, and data standards.
Share knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to improve efficiency and effectiveness within the Master Data governance process.
Fit/gap analysis and design decisions, ensuring deviations from standard functionality are justified.
Collaborate effectively with key business decision makers and end users to resolve issues.
Coordinate execution of project tasks in your functional area and be comfortable in working under the pressure of tight project deadlines.
Ability to continuously learn new and improve existing skills in technologies and solutions such as SAP MDG and others.
Keeps the work atmosphere FUN by keeping it light and welcoming.
Other duties as required.


Reporting Relationships


This position reports to the Manager of Enterprise Master Data & Analytics.
This role will have no direct reports.


Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology or a related field is required.
Industry Knowledge: Understanding of the Food or CPG industry is preferred.
3 plus years of experience in master data management, preferably within an SAP S/4HANA environment.
Strong understanding of SAP S/4HANA master data structures and processes.
Proficiency in data governance and data quality management tools.
Experience with SAP Fiori and SAP MDG (Master Data Governance) is preferred.
Certification in SAP S/4HANA or related modules is preferred.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work both in a team environment and independently.
Strong organizational, time management, facilitation, and process management skills.
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
PASSIONATE and has a desire to learn, roll-up their sleeves and set an example as a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù
Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support
Experience in preparation & Execution of Test Cases / Test Plans / Test scripts
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
Ability to prioritize and multitask multiple projects at the same time
Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration with a proven ability to successfully deal with complex issues working within the context of cross-functional teams
Exceptional time management and organizational skills, self-starter with a high level of initiative and ADAPTABILITY
TEAM player with a positive attitude
Demonstrates HUMILITY throughout the company on a daily basis
Aptitude to exhibit, RESPECT and protect Riverside‚Äôs Core Values in a changing environment


The Fit:

You:


Live to bring purpose and meaning to work for yourself, and most importantly, for others;
Are an ambassador and true believer in the purpose and values of the organization you work with as they are an extension of who you are;
Are passionate about leveraging technology to create a better experience for employees and all stakeholders;
Thrive in an entrepreneurial environment where ambiguity is an opportunity to create value;
Exhibit a mindset of continuous improvement;
Believe we can save our planet;


We:


Live for our purpose;
Live by our values;
Always strive for the mutually beneficial win-win with our stakeholders;
Believe in the ‚Äúand‚Äù not ‚Äúor‚Äù;
Strive for a net positive impact to our planet;


What We Offer:


Immerse yourself in our comprehensive benefits program, with Riverside taking care of the costs!
RRSP matching or IRA matching for an empowered financial journey
Join Employee-Led Resource Groups (ERGs) championing mental health, sustainability, diversity, women, and LGBTQ+ rights
Develop your career further through our Riverside University program and with our Tuition Reimbursement Program
An open concept work environment that embodies our Values


How to Apply:

If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line SAP Master Data Analystor click the apply button!

Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual‚Äôs passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We‚Äôre a technology company that leads with our humanity‚Äîdriving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community to get relevant job alerts straight to your inbox.

Why Ciena


We are big proponents of life-work integration and provide the flexibility and tools to make it a reality with remote work and potentially, part-time work.
We believe an inclusive, diverse, and barrier-free work environment makes for empowered and committed employees.
We recognize the importance of well-being and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families and offer a variety of paid family leave programs.
We are committed to employee development, offering tuition reimbursement and a variety of in-house learning and mentorship opportunities.
We know that financial security is important. We offer competitive salaries and incentive programs, RSU‚Äôs (job level specific) and an employee share option purchase program.
We realize time away to recharge is non-negotiable. We offer flexible paid time off!
Great work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for exemplary performance.


How You Will Contribute

As a Senior Data Analyst reporting to the Manager of Enterprise Analytics, your role will involve collaborating with the business to gather requirements, analyzing data patterns, designing solutions, and providing analytics and reports using different reporting tools. Your primary objective will be to assist the business in extracting valuable insights from data. It is essential for you to have experience with reporting platforms, a strong understanding of data modeling techniques, operational reporting, analytics, and data engineering systems. You will closely collaborate with the business, data engineering team, data visualization/report developers, and UX team to deliver exceptional products that offer data insights through high-quality visuals.


Collaborate with teams such as data visualization, data engineering, UX, and various business departments including Finance, Supply Chain, Purchasing, Software, Services, and Sales to gain a comprehensive understanding of business requirements.
Analyze data patterns, present it back to business to refine the requirement.
Translate and document business analytical needs into detailed requirements for data visualization developers / data engineers.
Develop and maintain analytics roadmap and works on data projects that spans multiple technologies.
Owns design, data models, development, and timelines for delivery of data visualization dashboard pulling data from data warehouse (Snowflake) or other sources.
Interacts closely with matrixed cross-functional teams (business and IT) to secure alignment.
Provide guidance to junior staff on data model design, BI tool best practices, and code review.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


What Does Ciena Expect of You?


Initiative ‚Äì you‚Äôre a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines.
A customer first mentality ‚Äì what‚Äôs important to the customer is also important to you.
Agility ‚Äì you are readily able to manage competing and ever-changing priorities and maintain a balanced and methodical approach to problem solving.
Communication expertise ‚Äì you possess the ability to tailor your message and ideas to the audience to ensure understanding and consensus.
The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team ‚Äì you thrive in a team environment, are comfortable working independently, and know how to get things done in a virtual environment.
Relationship builder ‚Äì with a proven ability to influence, you‚Äôre able to quickly develop trusted connections and get work done through others.


The Must Haves


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Accounting, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a relevant field.
Excellent understanding of business concepts, data analysis, and the ability to effectively communicate and translate stakeholder requirements into delivery plans.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in building robust data models, dashboards, and reports using analytical tools such as Power BI and Looker, with a focus on promoting self-serve analytics.
Strong knowledge of Snowflake SQL and DBT ETL is highly advantageous.
Deep understanding of data governance and management principles, with a strong emphasis on documentation and scalability across cross-functional teams.
Proven project management skills and the ability to work independently, prioritize workloads, and manage multiple responsibilities and deadlines.
Strong problem-solving skills, a team player mentality, customer focus, and the ability to collaborate and think critically are essential.


Assets


Approach to solving problems, effective communication, and ownership.
Agile mindset and good understanding of MVP / iterative development is desired.


Compensation And Benefits

The annual pay range for this position in US is 108,900 - 173,900 USD.

The annual pay range for this position in Canada is 88,900 - 141,900 CAD.

Pay ranges at Ciena are designed to accommodate variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions, and locations, reflecting our diverse products, industries, and lines of business. Please note that the pay range information provided in this posting pertains specifically to the primary location, which is the top location listed in case multiple locations are available.

Non-Sales employees may be eligible for a discretionary incentive bonus, while Sales employees may be eligible for a sales commission. In addition to competitive compensation, Ciena offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision plans, participation in 401(K) (USA) & DCPP (Canada) with company matching, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company-paid holidays, paid sick leave, and vacation time. We also comply with all applicable laws regarding Paid Family Leave and other leaves of absence.

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community to get relevant job alerts straight to your inbox.

At Ciena, we are committed to building and fostering an environment in which our employees feel respected, valued, and heard. Ciena values the diversity of its workforce and respects its employees as individuals. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.

Ciena is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status.

If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, please advise Ciena of any accommodation measures you may require.

  • Agile mindset and good understanding of MVP / iterative development is desired.

Compensation And Benefits

The annual pay range for this position in US is 108,900 - 173,900 USD.

The annual pay range for this position in Canada is 88,900 - 141,900 CAD.

Pay ranges at Ciena are designed to accommodate variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions, and locations, reflecting our diverse products, industries, and lines of business. Please note that the pay range information provided in this posting pertains specifically to the primary location, which is the top location listed in case multiple locations are available.

Non-Sales employees may be eligible for a discretionary incentive bonus, while Sales employees may be eligible for a sales commission. In addition to competitive compensation, Ciena offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision plans, participation in 401(K) (USA) & DCPP (Canada) with company matching, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company-paid holidays, paid sick leave, and vacation time. We also comply with all applicable laws regarding Paid Family Leave and other leaves of absence.

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community to get relevant job alerts straight to your inbox.

At Ciena, we are committed to building and fostering an environment in which our employees feel respected, valued, and heard. Ciena values the diversity of its workforce and respects its employees as individuals. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.

Ciena is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status.

If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, please advise Ciena of any accommodation measures you may require.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Who is Mother Parkers?
We are one of the largest tea and coffee manufacturers in North America, with a mission to create a better beverage experience for our customers. As a leading customer solutions provider to some of North America‚Äôs largest retailers and foodservice chains, we use state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation to help our customers grow their business and deliver superior products to their clientele. Our team of coffee and tea experts are deeply passionate about what we do, proud of our 100+ years of business success, and excited about building a future with endless possibilities. Come join our team and work among the best, collaborate with high performers, and contribute to challenging work every day!
The Role:
Our Commodities Procurement team is looking for a highly organized and analytical individual to join their team as a Sr Data Analyst. In this role, you will bring best practices and focus on system capability and automation; process development and improvement; refinement of cost analysis and forecasting models; key departmental reporting; and risk management compliance in a fast-moving procurement environment. You will also be responsible for delivering value-added business analytics as well as reporting meaningful financial and operational metrics that lead to insightful, accurate business decision-making and operational efficiencies.
We are looking for someone who has the desire to understand business drivers, initiatives and blockers; has strong organizational and communication skills; and can prioritize work effectively. You will help to elevate the team‚Äôs performance by taking initiative, being persistent and creative, and have a passion for continuous improvement.
What you get to do:

Conduct requirements analysis and translate data into informative and actionable reports, dashboards and KPI's across the Procurement Department.
Maintain and develop new approaches to automate internal and external data retrieval, customer/vendor reporting and operational process.
Interface with cross-functional teams to build centralized/custom data analytics tools to enhance the business process.
Own and develop queries and data visualizations for ad-hoc, recurring, troubleshooting requests and projects. Create exploratory data analysis, reports, dashboards to surface data for different stakeholders.
Through data led analysis, provide insight to optimize long-term cost saving growth and support related strategic initiatives (both ad hoc analytics and on-going reporting).
Coordinate with IT to efficiently perform activities related to integration of data and systems.
Simplify complex analyses and create clear and concise stories to motivate the department and company to make better data-driven decisions.
Prepare presentations on department performance, risk management performance and cost savings initiatives.
Challenge the Procurement Leadership Team on best practices and opportunities.
Build and maintain departmental savings and inventory budget as well as latest estimate models.
What you bring to the role:

Strong understanding of enterprise resource planning (ERP) and supply chain modules including (but not limited to) Master Planning, Procurement and Sourcing and, Inventory Management (preferably in Microsoft AX/D365).
3 years+ of Power Business Intelligence (Power BI) experience working on dashboards and data visualization along with good understanding of BI architecture.
Intermediate knowledge of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and relevant tools is preferred.
Intermediate knowledge of Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization, is preferred.
What we offer you:

Flex hours and the opportunity to work from home.
Competitive Total Rewards package ‚Äì health benefits coverage on day 1, 3 weeks of vacation.
Employee discount program on our coffee and tea products.
Dress for your day ‚Äì when you‚Äôre in the office, come in your jeans, or a business suit if you‚Äôre meeting with a client.

By providing your information to us, you understand and agree to Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee‚Äôs Privacy Policy:https://www.mother-parkers.com/privacy-policy/

While Mother Parkers welcomes all applications, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or search firms. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted.Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LeverageTek is actively seeking a Data Analyst for a 12-month contract with its Ottawa-based customer.




Work Location

Remote




Security Requirement

Must have a Government of Canada Enhanced Reliability Clearance.




Equipment Required

You will be expected to have your own laptop to perform the work. A laptop will not be provided.




Key Tasks

Supporting mainframe decommissioning by retargeting key business processes into existing or new applications
Carry out data analysis activities by evaluating current state, performing data gap analysis and support development of future state data needs
Work closely with key business stakeholders to document current state and requirements, examine data, and evaluate patterns and troubleshoot issues, and provide recommendations on solutions based on data management best practices




Key Qualifications

Well-rounded experience in the whole data lifecycle management and hands-on experience in the following data management domains: dimensional and relational data modeling, data quality, SQL programming (minimum 5 years), ETL development, metadata management and master data management, and business intelligence
Experience with reverse engineering the source to target mapping to gain data insights
Experience refactoring existing SQL code to new/alternate data sources




Qualifications

Experience with Azure Data Platform technologies or other public cloud offerings
Experience with Databricks
Demonstrated experience working with key business stakeholders in areas of Finance, Risk Management and Insurance
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.




Assets

Greater than 5 years of SQL development and refactoring existing SQL
Experience working in an Agile environment/team

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote - Canada)
Description:
Summary

Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we‚Äôre a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. All new engineers deploy working code their first week, and we strive to broaden individual impact with support from managers, mentors, and teams. At the end of the day, we‚Äôre all about helping our users, growing as engineers, and having fun in a collaborative environment.

Are you strongly driven by a passion for data analysis, complex problem-solving, and designing business intelligence solutions? As a Business Intelligence Analyst at Yelp, you‚Äôll work with partners and stakeholders across the company ‚Äî including our Executive Leadership, Finance, BizOps, Product, Data Science, Data Engineering, Marketing, and People teams ‚Äî to provide relevant data and visualization for key business decisions.

Yelp's Business Intelligence team is dedicated to empowering Yelp's leadership and analytics teams with trusted and reusable data visualizations, data warehousing products, and BI platform support. The work of our team continuously evolves with the company‚Äôs needs and is critical to Yelp‚Äôs data-driven decision making. We are looking for someone adept at engaging with business partners, who understands their needs, and who is passionate about diving into data, unraveling complexities, and designing business intelligence solutions.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada. We‚Äôd love to have you apply, even if you don‚Äôt feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we‚Äôre looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

What You'll Do


Build relationships with key business partners, lead requirement gathering sessions, analyze source data and systems, and provide feedback on detailed data analysis to guide data-driven decision making.
Become a subject matter expert on Yelp data and share knowledge with Engineering, Product, and other teams to refine business understanding, and identify areas of needed business improvement.
Plan and execute business intelligence/analytics projects by collaborating with business partners, data engineering, and data visualization teams.
Contribute to data strategy for data warehousing, reporting, dashboards, and self-service analytics.
Exercise advanced knowledge of SQL to extract critical information and business value from data spread across multiple databases and data formats.
Provide training and ongoing support to business users on business intelligence products.


What It Takes To Succeed


Ideally 3 years of experience in business intelligence or as a business systems analyst, data analyst/developer or similar role.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau preferred).
Experience documenting business and technical requirements and directly interacting with engineers on business intelligence projects.
Excellent collaboration, communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
Working knowledge of statistics and KPIs (LTV, Churn, etc.).
Advanced SQL skills and experience writing complex queries.
Knowledge and working experience with dimensional data modeling.


What You'll Get


Compensation range is $82,000-230,000 annually. Depending on your role and level, you may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
This opportunity has the option to be fully remote in all locations across Canada.
You can find more information about Yelp's five star benefits here!


Closing

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education ‚Äî and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include ‚ÄúPlaying Well With Others‚Äù and ‚ÄúAuthenticity.‚Äù

We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 1-415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Recruiting and Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Agilus Work Solutions has a client looking for a highly skilled and motivated Sr. Data Engineer to join their team for an initial 6-month contract. This Data Engineer will work closely with data architects and business analysts to ensure data infrastructure is optimized for performance and scalability. The ideal candidate will have experience designing/developing data pipelines to ingest, store, and transform data from a variety of sources, monitoring data quality and performance, and provide troubleshooting when needed and developing data models and algorithms to optimize data architecture.

Responsibilities:

Accelerate data-informed decision-making to transform our product and engineering strategy
Architect scalable date models and build efficient and reliable ETL pipelines to bring data to our core data warehouse
Design and develop highly scalable and reliable data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure smooth data flow and accessibility (Informatica IICS preferred)
Demonstrably deep understanding of SQL and analytical data warehouses (Snowflake preferred)
Professional experience using Python for data processing
Knowledge of and experience with data-related Python packages
Develop and maintain data warehousing and storage solutions to ensure data is stored securely and efficiently.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement data models and data warehouse architecture that supports business needs.
Optimize the performance of our data pipelines and data warehouse by implementing best practices and continuous improvement.
Develop and implement data governance policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy, security, and compliance with industry regulations.
Constantly improve product quality, security, and performance
Understand and implement data engineering best practices
Improve, manage, and teach standards for code maintainability and performance in code submitted and reviewed
Generate architecture recommendations and the ability to implement them
Great communication: Regularly achieve consensus amongst teams
Documentation of the work in Confluence

Requirements:

Minimum of five years of experience as a data engineer focusing on building scalable data pipelines and data warehouses.
Strong proficiency in Snowflake, AWS Cloud, Airflow, Snowpipe, SQL, Unix, Python, and API integrations.
Strong knowledge of data warehousing and modelling concepts, with experience designing and building large-scale data solutions.
Experience developing and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines and data integration solutions.
Strong SQL skills, with experience in performance tuning and optimization of complex queries.
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience developing and maintaining data processing scripts.
Experience in API development and integration with third-party systems.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets and identify trends and insights; think creatively and outside the box.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience with agile development methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban.
Design and optimize the SQL syntax and queries for faster data processing
Dimensional modelling experience is mandatory
Adoption of best development practices for batch processing
Managing all work in Jira, including but not limited to story creation, defect resolution etc
Identifies opportunities for new architectural initiatives and recommends the increased scalability and robustness of platforms and solutions.
Extensive experience in establishing data warehouses/lakes, has solid experience with Cloud-based data storage solutions (AWS S3 specifically).
Good understanding of data-driven system integration (web services and ETL/batch jobs), establishing the organization‚Äôs canonical data models and ability to work with XML and JSON-based data formats.
Experience with description techniques for data architecture and the relationship of data with other architecture domains (e.g. data representations in business and application process models).
Education, Qualifications and Certifications: A university degree in computer science or an approved equivalent combination of education and experience.

Title: Inventory Data Analyst
Description:
Leavitt Machinery‚ÄØis one of the fastest growing material handling equipment dealerships in North America. With an entrepreneurial spirit, mission-driven approach, and customer-focused mindset, Leavitt has achieved consistent growth over the past 25 years.

Leavitt Machinery is now an integral entity within the Venturis group of companies, an integrated and expanding network of businesses, including over 60+ branches and 1400+ employees across Canada and the USA. Venturis Capital strategically invests in visionary and values-driven organizations, with expertise in the material handling equipment industry.

In addition to our expanding dealership network, the Venturis portfolio includes complementary companies providing financing, freight and logistics, parts manufacturing, industrial parts supply, component rebuilding, training solutions, and marketing.

With a focus on learning and continuous improvement, we are proud to invest in our people and offer a progressive and flexible work culture where you can develop and advance your career while focusing on meaningful work.

The Opportunity

Leavitt Machinery is looking for an Inventory Data Analyst to join our team in Coquitlam, BC. As the Inventory Data Analyst, you will partner with stakeholders to ensure their needs are met by the Parts department, while capitalizing on opportunities to drive business success.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

As the Inventory Data Analyst your key responsibilities will include:


Manage and monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal inventory
Conduct periodic inventory audits to ensure accuracy
Perform cycle counts and reconcile discrepancies
Coordinate and support annual count of all inventories
Analyze inventory data to identify trends, forecast needs, and optimize inventory levels
Generate and present reports on inventory levels, usage rates, and forecasted needs
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory management
Use historical data to identify demand patterns and adjust inventory levels accordingly
Work with Sales and Operations teams to understand future demand and plan inventory needs
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance inventory management efficiency
Leverage inventory management software and other technologies to streamline operations
Analyze inventory-related costs and identify areas for cost reduction
Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards
Maintain safe inventory storage practices and ensure adherence to safety standards
Provide support to internal teams by ensuring the availability of required parts
Ensure all inventory-related documentation is complete and accurate


Required Skills & Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills, knowledge, and competencies:


Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, business administration, or a related field preferred
Prior experience in inventory management or a related field
Familiarization with Lean concepts & principles will be considered a strong asset
Previous experience with Microsoft Dynamics ERP is considered an asset
Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros, and data visualization
Experience with tools such as SQL, Tableau, and Power BI for creating detailed reports
Excellent communication skills, organizational skills, and analytical skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities in parallel and excel in a fast-paced work environment
High level of accuracy and attention to detail


Benefits & Perks

Leavitt Machinery Canada is proud to offer competitive compensation and flexible benefits coverage for all eligible employees, including an employer matching RRSP plan:


Company paid medical health care plan for you and your dependents
Extended health plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Dental plan, vision plan, and prescription drug coverage
Annual health care spending account
Life insurance, disability insurance, and travel insurance ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Sick leave plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Employee assistance programs
RRSP matching
Wellness days
Ongoing professional development opportunities

This is an onsite role based in Coquitlam, BC.

HTML:
Leavitt Machinery‚ÄØis one of the fastest growing material handling equipment dealerships in North America. With an entrepreneurial spirit, mission-driven approach, and customer-focused mindset, Leavitt has achieved consistent growth over the past 25 years.

Leavitt Machinery is now an integral entity within the Venturis group of companies, an integrated and expanding network of businesses, including over 60+ branches and 1400+ employees across Canada and the USA. Venturis Capital strategically invests in visionary and values-driven organizations, with expertise in the material handling equipment industry.

In addition to our expanding dealership network, the Venturis portfolio includes complementary companies providing financing, freight and logistics, parts manufacturing, industrial parts supply, component rebuilding, training solutions, and marketing.

With a focus on learning and continuous improvement, we are proud to invest in our people and offer a progressive and flexible work culture where you can develop and advance your career while focusing on meaningful work.

The Opportunity

Leavitt Machinery is looking for an Inventory Data Analyst to join our team in Coquitlam, BC. As the Inventory Data Analyst, you will partner with stakeholders to ensure their needs are met by the Parts department, while capitalizing on opportunities to drive business success.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

As the Inventory Data Analyst your key responsibilities will include:

  • Manage and monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal inventory
  • Conduct periodic inventory audits to ensure accuracy
  • Perform cycle counts and reconcile discrepancies
  • Coordinate and support annual count of all inventories
  • Analyze inventory data to identify trends, forecast needs, and optimize inventory levels
  • Generate and present reports on inventory levels, usage rates, and forecasted needs
  • Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory management
  • Use historical data to identify demand patterns and adjust inventory levels accordingly
  • Work with Sales and Operations teams to understand future demand and plan inventory needs
  • Identify and implement process improvements to enhance inventory management efficiency
  • Leverage inventory management software and other technologies to streamline operations
  • Analyze inventory-related costs and identify areas for cost reduction
  • Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards
  • Maintain safe inventory storage practices and ensure adherence to safety standards
  • Provide support to internal teams by ensuring the availability of required parts
  • Ensure all inventory-related documentation is complete and accurate

Required Skills & Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills, knowledge, and competencies:

  • Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, business administration, or a related field preferred
  • Prior experience in inventory management or a related field
  • Familiarization with Lean concepts & principles will be considered a strong asset
  • Previous experience with Microsoft Dynamics ERP is considered an asset
  • Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros, and data visualization
  • Experience with tools such as SQL, Tableau, and Power BI for creating detailed reports
  • Excellent communication skills, organizational skills, and analytical skills
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in parallel and excel in a fast-paced work environment
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Benefits & Perks

Leavitt Machinery Canada is proud to offer competitive compensation and flexible benefits coverage for all eligible employees, including an employer matching RRSP plan:

  • Company paid medical health care plan for you and your dependents
  • Extended health plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
  • Dental plan, vision plan, and prescription drug coverage
  • Annual health care spending account
  • Life insurance, disability insurance, and travel insurance ‚Äì 100% employer paid
  • Sick leave plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
  • Employee assistance programs
  • RRSP matching
  • Wellness days
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities

The base pay range for this role is: $50,000-$70,000 annually, depending on experience.

This is an onsite role based in Coquitlam, BC.

Leavitt Machinery & Venturis would like to thank all applicants for their interest, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an interview. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst ERP Project (3 Years Contract)
Description:
Requisition ID: 183567

Career Group: Corporate Office Careers

Job Category: Merchandising Strategy

Travel Requirements: 0 - 10%

Job Type: Part-Time

Country: Canada (CA)

Province: Nova Scotia; Alberta; British Columbia; Manitoba; Ontario

City: Stellarton, Mississauga, Toronto, Calgary, Victoria, Winnipeg

Embark on a rewarding career with Sobeys Inc., celebrated among Canada‚Äôs Top 100 employers, where your talents contribute to our commitment to excellence and community impact.

Our family of 128,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better ‚Äì great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.

A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1,600 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawtons Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.

Ready to Make an impact?

Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better ‚Äì great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.

A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawtons Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.

All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.

Here‚Äôs Where You‚Äôll Be Focusing


Work constructively with Project Teams to provide SME and guidance on master data, merchandising and replenishment.
Participate in project meetings for data migration.
Build knowledge on Sobeys Master data within these area‚Äôs ‚Äì store, merchandising and replenishment.
Provide and review project decision impacts and recommendations with Manager and Tower Leads.
Provide detailed knowledge of master data to project team.
Provide analysis to our current master data and Identify areas for cleansing and harmonization.
Create reporting to support the analysis; testing of the reporting
Coordinate data cleansing activities with the business.
Validate cleansing has been completed.
Build a strong relationship with project team.
Provide updates with project team, and manager as required.
Ensure on-time delivery of accountabilities within a project.
Provide data support to technical team.
Review data deliverables within project to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Create scripts for validations of data load to support.
Partner with the project team mates to complete pre load and post load validations of the data.
Contribute to the project planning process.
Participate in project process reviews and requirements gathering to ensure master data impacts are captured Lead data assignments
Attend project meetings
Partner with Merchandising and Replenishment to support in the testing and implementation of new processes effecting data, or which data impacts.
Perform, analyze and provide project analysis and support to the entire project team.


What You Have To Offer


Experience with retail master data
Merchandising or retail store and/or wholesale experience
Troubleshooting experience
Experience with continuous or process improvement
Knowledge of SAP and/or experience with retail data
Must be able to escalate issues to managers when required
Must be able to effectively articulate data teams position within project


At Sobeys we require our teammates to have the ability to adhere to a hybrid work model that requires your presence at one of our office locations at least three days per week. This requirement is integral to our commitment to team collaboration and the overall success of our office culture.

The salary range for this position in British Columbia is $60,666.00 - $83,416.00. We will consider factors such as your working location, work experience and skills as well as internal equity, and market conditions to ensure that you are paid fairly and competitively.

We are committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process.

Title: Data Analysis and Database Specialist
Description:
Data, Research and Evaluation

Full Time, Permanent

Hybrid

Level 7

Covenant House helps youth ignite their potential and reclaim their lives. As Canada‚Äôs largest agency serving youth who are homeless, trafficked or at risk, we offer the widest range of services to hundreds of young people every day.

More than a place to stay, we provide life-changing care with unconditional love and respect. We meet youth‚Äôs immediate needs and then we work together to achieve their future goals. We offer 24/7 crisis shelter transitional housing options on-site and, in the community, health and well-being support, training and skill development, and ongoing care once youth move into the community.

For over 40 years, Covenant House has been dedicated to its mission of serving youth on the street and to protect and safeguard all youth with absolute respect and unconditional love. Since 1982, Covenant House has supported more than 100,000 young people.

Overview


Reporting to the Efforts to Outcomes (ETO) Supervisor, the successful applicant will be responsible for:
Creating and generating reports using ETO client information system
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing extracts, reports, and performance indicators to identify and resolve problems, including data quality, integrity issues following data governance policies
Coordinates and prepares comprehensive data analysis and statistical reports for research, evaluation, policy, program and service activities
Using statistical analysis software to lead the development and delivery of functional analytics to support evidence-based decision-making.
Working with the department leads, Program Directors, and other relevant staff, ensure that the agency regularly reviews efforts towards outputs/outcomes (e.g., values, number of efforts, times spent)
Review all custom and standard reports for accuracy and timeliness so that the database maintains real time information about program participants and ensures that the agency has a process in place for a regular review conducted by appropriate staff (e.g., program manager)
Working with department leads to develop and maintain Policies, Standards and Controls about the safety of data in regard to regulatory compliance
Building advanced data visualizations (Tableau reports, infographics, scorecards, dashboards) that will support the dissemination of administrative data including outcomes and key performance indicators
Providing well-structured reports and documents to convey analysis and insights that are clear, concise and reader-friendly
Managing critical timelines and ensuring that deadlines are met
Performing other duties as required


Qualifications


The successful candidate will be a team player who has excellent communication and problem-solving skills. Their analytical ability and attention to detail coupled with their ability to prioritize and manage competing deadlines is a must.
Familiarity with ETO (Efforts to Outcomes) or another case management database is an asset.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, preferably within Computer Science, Statistics or approved equivalent combination of education and experience, with minimum two year‚Äôs experience in data analysis and management- including database design and advanced report writing using Structured Query Language (SQL) and other relational databases.
Experience with ETO, Tableau, and/or Qualtrics considered an asset
Experience with statistical software (e.g. R, SPSS)
Fluency in a programming language (e.g. Python) and or other programming languages would be an asset.
Proven passion for the data quality discipline
Strong interpersonal skills
Extremely meticulous in approach to work and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and within a team setting
Proven ability to meet established deadlines
Ability to quickly learn new tasks
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to multi-task and work on multiple projects simultaneously


Interested candidates should submit their cover letter and resume to this posting. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

At Covenant House Toronto we believe in a workplace culture of inclusion that is welcoming, respectful and safe for all staff. It is critical to Covenant House Toronto success to eliminate barriers and promote the inclusion of equity groups. Equity groups have been, and continue to be, underrepresented and marginalized in the workforce, leadership roles, and in some specific occupations. Equity groups include but may not be limited to Indigenous persons, racialized people, gender diverse people, 2SLGBTQIA+ people, and people with disabilities.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Covenant House Policy on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of the Covenant House recruitment process.

Please visit our careers page to see more job opportunities.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About KOHO

KOHO‚Äôs purpose is to empower Canadians to build a great financial foundation with products that are radically transparent and easy to manage. We first launched in 2017, and we have since built a community of over 1 million users . Leading investors around the globe believe in our vision, and we‚Äôve successfully raised over $320M to make our vision a reality.

Discover our culture here and get the inside scoop from our team here !

About The Role

KOHO is seeking a highly motivated Senior Data Analyst to collaborate with various departments in leveraging data for informed decision-making. If you thrive on automating reports, crafting insightful dashboards, and extracting actionable insights from financial data, this role is tailored for you. As part of our team, you will immerse yourself in writing SQL queries, crafting Python scripts, and engaging in consultative sessions with stakeholders across the business.

What You'll Do


Analyze existing data sources to develop accurate and insightful reports.
Create and deliver visually compelling dashboards to showcase key findings and emerging trends.
Perform in-depth analysis of marketing data to drive strategic decision-making.
Prioritize and manage incoming data requests effectively within your workflow.
Collaborate closely with other members of the data team to execute projects and uphold the integrity of our data warehouse as the cornerstone of truth at KOHO.


Who You Are


Proven experience in a data or marketing analyst role.
Proficiency in SQL for data manipulation, including self-joins, window functions, and parameter usage.
Intermediate proficiency in Python, including user-defined functions, API requests, and writing efficient loops.
Demonstrated experience with dbt from previous roles.
Basic proficiency in Python.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, coupled with adept data gathering abilities.
Quick grasp of business concepts, metrics, and KPIs.
Ability to effectively multitask and prioritize assignments.
Well-organized with excellent time management skills.


At KOHO, we are dedicated to providing pay transparency to all candidates. Compensation at KOHO is determined through various factors including but not limited to: comparable salary market data within Canada, technical skill assessment, a holistic view of previous work history, and internal pay equity with other KOHO team members.

Target Base Salary Range

$80,500 ‚Äî $105,000 CAD

What's In It For You?

We Invest Time And Resources Into Making Sure KOHO Is As Good As The People We Hire. Here Are Some Of The Reasons We Attract The Best People

üßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Balance Your Life - Company-wide summer wellness days, winter holiday closure, personal days, a wellness spending account, and maternity & parental leave top-up

üíª Remote First - Work from anywhere in Canada with a budget to set up your home office

üÜô Level Up - Access to an in-house certified performance coach and an annual training budget

ü•Ö Reach Your Goals - Salary assessments twice per year

üôå The KOHO Culture - We have won 7 "Great Place to Work ¬Æ" awards since 2019

ü§ù Be an Owner - Every KOHO employee gets a generous amount of equity with a 10 year exercise window

The KOHO culture is one of collaboration, creativity, and diverse perspectives. We are committed to building and fostering an inclusive, accessible environment for everyone. If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding accessibility needs, please contact peopleaccessibility@koho.ca and the People and Culture team will be happy to help.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Join Scene+ and be part of Canada's most robust lifestyle loyalty program with over 15 million members and growing! We are a trusted brand, driven by the belief that there's always something to look forward to with rewards for every kind of life. Our goal is to become Canada's favourite loyalty program by nurturing our Members with rewards their way.

We're the exciting joint venture of Cineplex, Empire, and Scotiabank, blending the energy, optimism, and atmosphere of a startup with the support of three iconic Canadian companies. With over 100 team members and plans to grow more, we're an emerging, responsive company. We offer collaboration, accountability, challenges, and rewards to everyone who joins us.

Our motto is "Love what's next," and we believe it applies to your career too. Join us to help evolve the program, collaborate with amazing teams, and love what lies ahead.

Who We Need

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Intelligence, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who can take the data and tell a story from multiple perspectives. We are one of Canada's top loyalty programs with 15 million+ members. You will tap into our rich cross-industry data resources to bring proven value to our owners and partners and delight our members.

This is a hybrid role with the requirement to work in-office five days over two weeks.

What's in it for you:

Ownership. We are a data science-driven company, and our membership is growing exponentially. We are adaptable, collaborative, and fast-paced. You will have the opportunity to recommend and work with new tools and processes, share knowledge, and introduce best practices. Joining us at this stage is a chance to channel your passion for technology toward creating new capabilities and enabling the company to make intelligent decisions.

Future forward impact. You'll be part of a future-forward team that values authenticity and invites fresh perspectives. You will gain exposure to every major customer-driven industry - and access to vast volumes of diverse data. You will receive in-depth onboarding, access to insights into growing a national loyalty program, and the visibility you need to make an impact, including the opportunity to present your findings to our SVP or President regularly. Whether you want to increase your influence with us directly or with a parent company, there is always something to look forward to.

As our new Senior Data Analyst, you will:


Share insights. You will extract insights from the data to learn more about our members. You will distill the technical language from these insights to translate your findings into accessible, engaging language, data visualizations, and other forms of presentation for our leadership and non-technical teams to understand and apply
Code. You will use Python and SQL to gather, clean, organize, and analyze structured and nonstructured data. You will draw on your insights and experience to choose the most effective and impact charts, graphs, and diagrams to illustrate the results and recommendations of your data analysis
Analyze. You will dive into the consumer data to generate owner-specific reports. You will explore anomalies, finding root causes or drawing attention to trends that can be capitalized
Collaborate. You will work as part of the Business Intelligence and Data Engineering teams to automate processes, improve the data quality for our machine learning models and add more value to our loyalty product


You bring:


The experience. You can tell a story with data and visual presentations. You have worked as a Data or Business Analyst at a fast-paced startup in a collaborative and autonomous role. Or, you may be coming from another industry and looking for a challenge to innovate and propose changes with less red tape and more responsiveness. You enjoy continuously exploring what can be learned and applied from data
The technical skills. You know how to use the latest tools to work with terabytes of data - defining the query parameters, accessing large sets, conducting analyses, and gleaning insights. You are proficient in Python, SQL, and Tableau and can quickly come up to speed with new technologies. You have in-depth experience building reports connecting data sources and creating visualizations that present the data most effectively
Interpersonal skills. You can nurture relationships across internal and external teams. You have professional communication skills, including making presentations to senior leadership. You can translate complex data analytics and findings into visualizations and actionable insights for different audiences and levels


Join us.

At Scene+, we cultivate an innovative and collaborative environment. Guided by our values, we aim to exceed the expectations of our partners and members.

Member Focus: We prioritize the needs and experiences of our members in everything we do.

Teamwork: We believe in the power of collaboration and working together to achieve our goals.

Continuous Improvement: We strive for excellence by constantly seeking ways to improve and innovate.

Integrity: We uphold the highest standards of honesty and transparency in our actions.

Results Driven: We are committed to achieving outstanding outcomes and delivering value.

Passion: We are passionate about our work and dedicated to making a positive impact.

We offer:

Perks: Enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, performance-based bonuses, and extra rewards from our owners, including discounted rates on mortgages, banking, movies, and more.

Warmth: We foster a genuine culture where relationships, knowledge sharing, and creativity thrive.

Growth: Working for Scene+ offers exposure to a range of industries represented by our owners and partners. You'll have the chance to work on diverse initiatives, collaborate with cross-company teams, and expand your career path options both internally and with our owners.

What you can expect from our interview process:


A virtual interview with a Talent Advisor discussing your interest in the role and the company and how you will make an impact as our new Senior Data Analyst, followed by a SQL assessment
An interview with the Manager, Data & Analytics, preceded by a case study assignment. During this 1-hour time slot, you will present your case study analysis and answer questions. You will have the chance to learn more about the team and to share your experience. It's a chance to ask questions about the company and the role
An interview with the Director, of Business Intelligence & Data Engineering to share why you are interested in joining Scene+ in this role, and share more about your professional goals. It's a chance to ask questions about the company's growth trajectory


Apply now.

If you have 70% of what we're looking for and 100% authenticity and passion, express your interest here. Please contact us by email at careers@scene.ca and let us know what accommodations or assistance we can provide you during the application process.

At Scene+, we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We strive to integrate these values into everything we do, from our partners and offers to our teams and interactions. We welcome and appreciate candidates from diverse backgrounds, including women, persons with disabilities, Black, Indigenous and People of Colour (BIPOC), the LGBTQ2SIA+ community, and other equity-seeking groups.

We are a trusted brand, driven by the belief that there's always something to look forward to with rewards for every kind of life. Our goal is to become Canada's favourite loyalty program by nurturing our Members with rewards their way.

We're the exciting joint venture of Cineplex, Empire, and Scotiabank, blending the energy, optimism, and atmosphere of a startup with the support of three iconic Canadian companies. With over 100 team members and plans to grow more, we're an emerging, responsive company. We offer collaboration, accountability, challenges, and rewards to everyone who joins us.

Our motto is "Love what's next," and we believe it applies to your career too. Join us to help evolve the program, collaborate with amazing teams, and love what lies ahead.

Who We Need

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Intelligence, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who can take the data and tell a story from multiple perspectives. We are one of Canada's top loyalty programs with 15 million+ members. You will tap into our rich cross-industry data resources to bring proven value to our owners and partners and delight our members.

This is a hybrid role with the requirement to work in-office five days over two weeks.

Ownership. We are a data science-driven company, and our membership is growing exponentially. We are adaptable, collaborative, and fast-paced. You have in-depth experience building reports connecting data sources and creating visualizations that present the data most effectively

Title: Business Systems & Data Analyst
Description:
Mattr delivers advanced material technologies and complex manufacturing expertise. Through a portfolio of brands, we offer highly engineered solutions, technology and products to support infrastructure markets worldwide.

Shawflex is the Market Leader and a Trusted Brand in the Electrical Infrastructure industry with a wide variety of wire and cable solutions from common to custom. Our Business Model thrives on our Strong Channel Relationships and Entrepreneurial Culture where we champion in providing unique engineered-to-order product offerings to our customers.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Data & Business Systems Analyst will support the business across a range of process & system improvements & data collection initiatives. The candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for using data to drive business insights. As part of that role, they will support the day-to-day management of reporting and be the business intelligence lead in numerous projects, working cross-functionally with internal stakeholders. They will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, generating insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency.

DUTIES:

DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING


Analyze operational and commercial data and develop insights to drive business decisions, with a focus on financial and manufacturing accounting concepts
Build and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards that provide meaningful insights to stakeholders, with the ability to bridge business processes to the system
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for process improvements and cost savings, and translate them into data-driven solutions
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support business initiatives and strategic projects, with a focus on both high-level and detailed analysis
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, with the ability to bridge business processes to the system and analytical insights


SYSTEMS SUPPORT & EXPANSION


Proactively examine current systems to pinpoint strengths, manage risks and identify weaknesses and support continuous improvement projects
Analyze and troubleshoot ERP & CRM system issues reported by end users
Provide a customer service/consultant type role in meeting directly with internal users to find out their related needs, address pain points
Suggest and propose process improvements through the quality of reporting data
Manage projects related to enhancement and implementation of core business systems
Facilitate and function as a liaison between business and technical units and to design solutions to meet business requirements.
Determine scope and prepare detailed requirements documents for tasks and projects up to high complexity to ensure scope and business requirements are understood and acceptable to all impacted areas


Other Duties


Support the business to ensure division and corporate yearly targets are met.
Participate in continuing professional development by attending workshops, seminars, and conferences to obtain and maintain knowledge and skills related to the work performed
Other ad-hoc projects and duties as assigned


SAFETY


Maintain a safe working environment by aligning with corporate safety rules and regulations, and ensuring a culture of safety
Ensure that the equipment and process operate efficiently and safely


Every worker shall,


Cooperate with their employer for the purposes of protecting the health and safety of themselves as well as other workers either engaged or at the work site where the work is being carried out


Every employer shall, as far as it is reasonably practicable to ensure:


The health and safety of workers and others at the work site
That the workers are aware of their health and safety responsibilities and duties


REQUIREMENTS:


Minimum Bachelor's Degree preferably in Engineering (Industrial, Computer), Business, Math, or similar Analytical Field
Minimum 3 to 5 years of related experience
Strong Analytical and reporting skills
Previous experience in Manufacturing - preferred
Previous experience using SQL, Power BI, Tableau or similar tools.
Previous experience using ERP and CRM systems - preferred
Strong experience using Microsoft Excel


What Mattr Offers


At Mattr, safety comes first! We go the extra mile to ensure our employees are safe and healthy
We understand times have changed and so have we. Mattr offers flexible work arrangements (where possible) to suit your needs
Comprehensive total rewards package that includes competitive salaries, annual incentives, medical benefits, retirement savings plans, paid vacation days, education assistance programs, corporate discounts and more!
Participation in service milestone awards and recognition opportunities
Access to mental health support resources such as our Headversity mental health and wellness platform and free, confidential access to our Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)
Rewarding growth opportunities (may include global career and travel opportunities) supported by personalized training, development and mentoring programs
Commitment to providing a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace environment
We prioritize our Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) values and offer a paid Volunteer Time Off Program, allowing employees an opportunity to support charitable organizations in their communities
Company events, social gatherings and team building activities that promote fun!
We‚Äôre working to create a better world. Join us!


Mattr delivers advanced material technologies and complex manufacturing expertise through brands offering engineered products, technology and solutions to support infrastructure projects & markets world-wide. Mattr brands: Shawflex, DSG-Canusa, Flexpipe, Xerxes and Shawcor.

At Mattr, we have built a true team environment where all employees are empowered to contribute to the success of the company. We want you to join our team!

We thank all applicants for their interest; however we cannot accept telephone calls regarding this position. All recruiting activities are managed via our Recruitment Management System and you must apply via the link below or the posting on our career page at https://careers.mattr.com/ to be considered for this opportunity.
