Title: Remote Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Job Description: Rebel Apparel Inc. is seeking a skilled Remote Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports. Your primary focus will be to develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, and analytics tools that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The ideal candidate will have a strong ability to analyze trends and provide actionable insights to enhance decision-making processes across the organization.

Responsibilities


Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.


Requirements


Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.


Preferred Qualifications


Proven experience working in an e-commerce or retail environment.
Advanced degree in a related field.
Certification in Data Analytics.


Join Rebel Apparel Inc. and help us redefine the future of fashion through data-driven insights and innovation. Apply now to become a part of our passionate team!

Title: SAP Master Data Analyst
Company: Riverside Natural Foods Ltd. (Home of MadeGood)
Description:
Are you hungry to innovate? To do things differently? To work with a company that‚Äôs real, thoughtful and very forward-thinking?

Meet Riverside. We are an organic, ‚Äúbetter for you‚Äù snack company, manufacturing award-winning, nutritious, allergen-free snacks. Your kids know us as MadeGood, tasty school-safe snacks. Your buddies on the go grab our GOOD TO GO delicious and nutritious snacks.

At Riverside, we make delicious snacks that are good in every way. From our ingredients to our manufacturing practices, we‚Äôve raised every bar on every aspect. We‚Äôre friendly and focused on creating foods that are good for you and good to the planet as well. Riverside Natural Foods is B-Corp certified, Triple-Bottom Line, Zero Waste, and Canadian owned and operated.

Come work with a Canadian leader! We value teamwork, humility, respect, ownership, adaptability, grit and fun.

You can learn more about us at www.riversidenaturalfoods.com

The Opportunity:

As a family owned and led company, Riverside Natural Foods (‚ÄúRiverside‚Äù or the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) has the freedom to pursue our founders‚Äô vision of being a values-based and purpose driven food company that puts people first ‚Äì our employees, our consumers, our partners, and our communities. Our purpose of ‚Äúinspiring a healthier and more compassionate world‚Äù starts within our four walls and extends well beyond them to include everyone we can positively impact through our products, our business, and our relationships.

Position Summary:

A key aspect of our BT&T‚Äôs mission is to build and sustain a capable organization for profitable growth; this entails deploying and driving adoption of leading practices as well as effectively leveraging SAP and other enterprise technology. The Master Data Analyst is responsible for managing and maintaining the quality and integrity of master data within the system. This role is crucial for ensuring that data related to business partners, customers, suppliers, and products is accurate and up-to-date. This position will augment the bandwidth of our Master Data team to help with the implementation of SAP Master Data Governance platform as well as perform run-the-business Master Data related activities.

Primary Responsibilities:


Demonstrate and uphold Riverside Natural Food‚Äôs Core Values
Partner with Business Process owners, to provide end-to-end technology solutions implementation and Master Data enablement.
Data Maintenance: Regularly update and maintain master data to ensure accuracy and consistency. This includes using Fiori UI for enriching business data.
Data Governance: Implement data governance practices to consolidate, detect duplicates, and manage data quality. This involves mass processing capabilities to update multiple records at once.
Data Quality Management: Continuously monitor and improve data quality through regular audits and remediation processes.
User Support: Provide support and training to users on master data processes and best practices.
Reporting: Generate and analyze reports on data quality and integrity
Demonstrate OWNERSHIP, confidence, and the ability to make recommendations for selection of appropriate SAP best practices and solutions to meet business requirements effectively
Ensure technical design and delivery align with functional specifications and adhere to quality standards.
Document requirements, develops business process maps, creates project plans and training materials.
Knowledge of and ability to use approved testing methodologies, processes and procedures.
Provide input to data architecture, security, and data standards.
Share knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to improve efficiency and effectiveness within the Master Data governance process.
Fit/gap analysis and design decisions, ensuring deviations from standard functionality are justified.
Collaborate effectively with key business decision makers and end users to resolve issues.
Coordinate execution of project tasks in your functional area and be comfortable in working under the pressure of tight project deadlines.
Ability to continuously learn new and improve existing skills in technologies and solutions such as SAP MDG and others.
Keeps the work atmosphere FUN by keeping it light and welcoming.
Other duties as required.


Reporting Relationships


This position reports to the Manager of Enterprise Master Data & Analytics.
This role will have no direct reports.


Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology or a related field is required.
Industry Knowledge: Understanding of the Food or CPG industry is preferred.
3 plus years of experience in master data management, preferably within an SAP S/4HANA environment.
Strong understanding of SAP S/4HANA master data structures and processes.
Proficiency in data governance and data quality management tools.
Experience with SAP Fiori and SAP MDG (Master Data Governance) is preferred.
Certification in SAP S/4HANA or related modules is preferred.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work both in a team environment and independently.
Strong organizational, time management, facilitation, and process management skills.
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
PASSIONATE and has a desire to learn, roll-up their sleeves and set an example as a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù
Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support
Experience in preparation & Execution of Test Cases / Test Plans / Test scripts
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
Ability to prioritize and multitask multiple projects at the same time
Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration with a proven ability to successfully deal with complex issues working within the context of cross-functional teams
Exceptional time management and organizational skills, self-starter with a high level of initiative and ADAPTABILITY
TEAM player with a positive attitude
Demonstrates HUMILITY throughout the company on a daily basis
Aptitude to exhibit, RESPECT and protect Riverside‚Äôs Core Values in a changing environment


The Fit:

You:


Live to bring purpose and meaning to work for yourself, and most importantly, for others;
Are an ambassador and true believer in the purpose and values of the organization you work with as they are an extension of who you are;
Are passionate about leveraging technology to create a better experience for employees and all stakeholders;
Thrive in an entrepreneurial environment where ambiguity is an opportunity to create value;
Exhibit a mindset of continuous improvement;
Believe we can save our planet;


We:


Live for our purpose;
Live by our values;
Always strive for the mutually beneficial win-win with our stakeholders;
Believe in the ‚Äúand‚Äù not ‚Äúor‚Äù;
Strive for a net positive impact to our planet;


What We Offer:


Immerse yourself in our comprehensive benefits program, with Riverside taking care of the costs!
RRSP matching or IRA matching for an empowered financial journey
Join Employee-Led Resource Groups (ERGs) championing mental health, sustainability, diversity, women, and LGBTQ+ rights
Develop your career further through our Riverside University program and with our Tuition Reimbursement Program
An open concept work environment that embodies our Values


How to Apply:

If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line SAP Master Data Analystor click the apply button!

Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

We‚Äôre friendly and focused on creating foods that are good for you and good to the planet as well. Riverside Natural Foods is B-Corp certified, Triple-Bottom Line, Zero Waste, and Canadian owned and operated.

Come work with a Canadian leader! We value teamwork, humility, respect, ownership, adaptability, grit and fun.

You can learn more about us at www.riversidenaturalfoods.com

The Opportunity:

As a family owned and led company, Riverside Natural Foods (‚ÄúRiverside‚Äù or the ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) has the freedom to pursue our founders‚Äô vision of being a values-based and purpose driven food company that puts people first ‚Äì our employees, our consumers, our partners, and our communities. Our purpose of ‚Äúinspiring a healthier and more compassionate world‚Äù starts within our four walls and extends well beyond them to include everyone we can positively impact through our products, our business, and our relationships.

Position Summary:

A key aspect of our BT&T‚Äôs mission is to build and sustain a capable organization for profitable growth; this entails deploying and driving adoption of leading practices as well as effectively leveraging SAP and other enterprise technology. The Master Data Analyst is responsible for managing and maintaining the quality and integrity of master data within the system. This role is crucial for ensuring that data related to business partners, customers, suppliers, and products is accurate and up-to-date. This position will augment the bandwidth of our Master Data team to help with the implementation of SAP Master Data Governance platform as well as perform run-the-business Master Data related activities.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrate and uphold Riverside Natural Food‚Äôs Core Values
  • Partner with Business Process owners, to provide end-to-end technology solutions implementation and Master Data enablement.
  • Data Maintenance: Regularly update and maintain master data to ensure accuracy and consistency. This includes using Fiori UI for enriching business data.
  • Data Governance: Implement data governance practices to consolidate, detect duplicates, and manage data quality. This involves mass processing capabilities to update multiple records at once.
  • Data Quality Management: Continuously monitor and improve data quality through regular audits and remediation processes.
  • User Support: Provide support and training to users on master data processes and best practices.
  • Reporting: Generate and analyze reports on data quality and integrity
  • Demonstrate OWNERSHIP, confidence, and the ability to make recommendations for selection of appropriate SAP best practices and solutions to meet business requirements effectively
  • Ensure technical design and delivery align with functional specifications and adhere to quality standards.
  • Document requirements, develops business process maps, creates project plans and training materials.
  • Knowledge of and ability to use approved testing methodologies, processes and procedures.
  • Provide input to data architecture, security, and data standards.
  • Share knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to improve efficiency and effectiveness within the Master Data governance process.
  • Fit/gap analysis and design decisions, ensuring deviations from standard functionality are justified.
  • Collaborate effectively with key business decision makers and end users to resolve issues.
  • Coordinate execution of project tasks in your functional area and be comfortable in working under the pressure of tight project deadlines.
  • Ability to continuously learn new and improve existing skills in technologies and solutions such as SAP MDG and others.
  • Keeps the work atmosphere FUN by keeping it light and welcoming.
  • Other duties as required.

Reporting Relationships

  • This position reports to the Manager of Enterprise Master Data & Analytics.
  • This role will have no direct reports.

Qualifications

  • Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology or a related field is required.
  • Industry Knowledge: Understanding of the Food or CPG industry is preferred.
  • 3 plus years of experience in master data management, preferably within an SAP S/4HANA environment.
  • Strong understanding of SAP S/4HANA master data structures and processes.
  • Proficiency in data governance and data quality management tools.
  • Experience with SAP Fiori and SAP MDG (Master Data Governance) is preferred.
  • Certification in SAP S/4HANA or related modules is preferred.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work both in a team environment and independently.
  • Strong organizational, time management, facilitation, and process management skills.
  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
  • PASSIONATE and has a desire to learn, roll-up their sleeves and set an example as a ‚Äúdoer‚Äù
  • Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support
  • Experience in preparation & Execution of Test Cases / Test Plans / Test scripts
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
  • Ability to prioritize and multitask multiple projects at the same time
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration with a proven ability to successfully deal with complex issues working within the context of cross-functional teams
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills, self-starter with a high level of initiative and ADAPTABILITY
  • TEAM player with a positive attitude
  • Demonstrates HUMILITY throughout the company on a daily basis
  • Aptitude to exhibit, RESPECT and protect Riverside‚Äôs Core Values in a changing environment

The Fit:

You:

  • Live to bring purpose and meaning to work for yourself, and most importantly, for others;
  • Are an ambassador and true believer in the purpose and values of the organization you work with as they are an extension of who you are;
  • Are passionate about leveraging technology to create a better experience for employees and all stakeholders;
  • Thrive in an entrepreneurial environment where ambiguity is an opportunity to create value;
  • Exhibit a mindset of continuous improvement;
  • Believe we can save our planet;

We:

  • Live for our purpose;
  • Live by our values;
  • Always strive for the mutually beneficial win-win with our stakeholders;
  • Believe in the ‚Äúand‚Äù not ‚Äúor‚Äù;
  • Strive for a net positive impact to our planet;

What We Offer:

  • Immerse yourself in our comprehensive benefits program, with Riverside taking care of the costs!
  • RRSP matching or IRA matching for an empowered financial journey
  • Join Employee-Led Resource Groups (ERGs) championing mental health, sustainability, diversity, women, and LGBTQ+ rights
  • Develop your career further through our Riverside University program and with our Tuition Reimbursement Program
  • An open concept work environment that embodies our Values

How to Apply:

If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line SAP Master Data Analystor click the apply button!

Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Excel Data Entry Engineer
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly skilled Excel Data Entry Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be proficient in using Excel and possess a strong ability to input and manage data efficiently. This role involves working extensively with Excel formulas to ensure accurate data entry into our system. If you have a passion for data accuracy and enjoy working with spreadsheets, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities:


Perform daily data entry tasks using Excel and our internal system.
Utilize Excel formulas to accurately input and manipulate data.
Ensure data integrity and consistency across various platforms.
Collaborate with team members to gather and verify data.
Identify and resolve discrepancies in data entry.
Maintain organized and up-to-date records of all data entered.
Assist in developing and improving data entry processes.

Title: Analyst, Audience & Analytics
Description:
Position Summary

As an Analyst on the Audience and Analytics team, you will be positioned for rapid growth and gain hands-on experience working on advanced marketing analysis and audience projects. You will create, innovate, and guide the analytics process, and suggest recommendations on how to improve. You will work with engaged client teams, a variety of media, audience and analytics platforms, and data sources that are supported by a strong internal system. This role can be worked from our Toronto, Montreal or Vancouver offices.




Key Responsibilities

Providing audience and analytics services to our customers:

Collect and analyze web analytics data to identify business trends and opportunities. Create dashboards using a variety of visualization tools (ex: Analytics reporting, Audience performance/testing). Cearly communicate results to internal & external stakeholders.
Auditing of web analytic set-ups, recommendations for improvement and supporting implementation as needed
Working collaboratively with planning teams conduct audience research analysis to identify target audiences for clients. Develop and implement audience segmentation strategies using proprietary and syndicated tools
Develop point-of-view documents for internal & external stakeholders on audience & analytics topics (ex: technology partners, measurement best practices, privacy, etc.)

Developing optimal processes for performing analytics

Be the subject matter expert and educate the extended team on learnings across the various platforms

Work with Director of Audience & Analytics to create packaged Audience & Analytics products

Work closely with internal teams to identify client business needs and look for opportunities to create customized analyses to measure overall Audience and Media Performance
Draw on expertise of functional experts within internal teams to continually develop skills and capabilities




Desired Skills & Experience

Your Knowledge:

Demonstrated understanding of web analytic platforms and tagging structures, for Google Analytics 4, Adobe Analytics and other analytic tools, in particular Adobe Launch and GTM
Data visualization experience (Tableau, Data Studio, etc.)
Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
Basic Knowledge of digital media reporting platforms such as DCM, SA360, Facebook, DSPs and other digital reporting platforms
Media Research tools (Nielsen, Comscore, Vividata, Pathmatics)
Strong analytical abilities and quantitative skills
Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Ability to multi-task and take initiative




Your Skills & Requirements:

Google Analytics certification or Adobe Analytics equivalent with experience managing and manipulating accounts, properties, and views.
1+ years of experience in Marketing Analytics, Performance Analytics, Programming, Relational Database Work, or Relevant Academic Experience.
Experience in media research tools
Strong proficiency in use of Microsoft Excel and power point
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Advertising, Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or related field. OR equivalent professional work experience
Excellent interpersonal skills: able to maintain positive working relationships with a wide set of internal and external contacts
Technically-minded with a desire to learn about data, marketing and the future of adtech
Ability to make the complex simple when describing processes to audiences who might not be so expert in martech




Working collaboratively with Canada‚Äôs most iconic brands, Media Experts‚Äô mission is to forge deeper connections with consumers. Our comprehensive view of this diverse and ever-changing landscape allows us to create impactful integrated media solutions. Since 1981, we have stood out as pioneers, thought leaders and mavericks. Our playbook for success is built on innovative approaches and unique technologies and is firmly rooted in our culture of care and commitment to our partners and collaborators. We are uniquely positioned to help our clients win in the Canada of today and tomorrow.




Media Experts is a leading full-service media agency delivering integrated solutions for clients such as Bell Canada, Honda, Netflix, Interac, Moosehead, Pizza Pizza, Royal Canadian Mint and Specsavers. With three offices strategically located in Montreal, Toronto, and Vancouver, Media Experts is part of the IPG Mediabrands network. For more information, please visit www.mediaexperts.com.




What's in it for you?

‚Ä¢ Generous paid time off with a minimum of 37 paid days off including vacation and monthly wellness days. We also have four-day long weekends, half-day summer Fridays, and meeting-free Friday afternoons year-round.

‚Ä¢ A flexible hybrid work model that works for you.

‚Ä¢ A focus on personal development with formal training opportunities, including mental health training and inclusion education for everyone.

‚Ä¢ A chance to be part of and grow within a global network of agencies.

‚Ä¢ The opportunity to contribute to our company culture by joining one of our many community-based employee groups, such as Black Employee Network, Girls on Fire, Hispanic or Latinx Alliance, Neuro Network, Pan-Asian Network, and Rainbow Lounge.




Media Experts is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, colour, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, creed, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, provincial, or municipal law. If you require an accommodation in any aspect of the selection process, please reach out to canadatalent@mbww.com.

Title: Part-time Data Quality Analyst (Fraud Investigation)
Description:
Owl.co is a software company that enables insurers to fight illegitimate claims at scale while removing human bias from the process. Our clients are the top insurance companies across North America, and they are achieving incredible results through our AI-powered, evidence-based platform. We are on a mission to bring state-of-the-art ML and NLP methods to transform this traditionally manual activity into an equitable process. We are well-funded and have engineering offices in New York City, Toronto, and Vancouver.

We are looking for a Part-time Data Quality Analyst to join our team!

As a Data Quality Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in leveraging data to ensure the integrity and accuracy of insurance claims processing. Pulling from open data sources, you will support our clients in monitoring, detecting, and preventing potential illegitimate claims.

Responsibilities & Scope:


Conduct investigations utilizing open data sources and in partnership with Owl's AI
Ensure findings are inputted logically, leveraging our internal platform to guide the process
Analyze external claimant data for quality, completeness, and accuracy
Efficiently utilize time and resources to deliver high-quality results that maximize value for the company
Maintain the security and confidentiality of sensitive information
Operate within company security and disclosure guidelines



Requirements


Must be available 25-30 hours per week
Previous experience in open-source content research
Ability to work independently in a remote environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills for documenting research findings effectively
Very comfortable on the computer - ability to type quickly, utilize various search functions and keyboard shortcuts
Analytical thinker with the ability to exercise creative problem-solving during investigations
Ability to adapt quickly to evolving technologies and system processes.



Benefits

The compensation for this role is $20.00 per hour.


Bring your friends on board! Help grow our team of top performers and receive a cash bonus through our uncapped, generous Employee Referral Program

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

24WD80449

French job description to follow!/La description de poste en fran√ßais se trouve plus bas!

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in Canada. This is a hybrid full-time role, reporting to the Director of Customer Analytics. As a Business Intelligence Analyst Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to provide valuable insights into user behavior, their product usage patterns, and identifying opportunities for growth. You will help create dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to the stakeholders. Furthermore, you will use your expertise in creating and editing visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, and transforming data sets into visually compelling visuals. You will also provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with teams to understand business needs and requirements for data analysis
Design and develop data models, dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Create and edit visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, to provide visual representations of data insights
Transform quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals that effectively communicate important information
Use advanced statistical techniques to analyze and interpret complex datasets
Provide expert-level visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data visualization needs and provide recommendations on the most effective visual representation of data
Conduct quality checks on visual content to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines
Communicate complex data insights through visually compelling presentations and reports, tailored to different audiences


Minimum Requirements


Bachelor's/ Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role
Expertise in statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualisation
Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js
Experience working with large datasets and proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Samples / examples showcasing previous data analysis and visualization projects

24WD80449

French job description to follow!/La description de poste en fran√ßais se trouve plus bas!

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in Canada. This is a hybrid full-time role, reporting to the Director of Customer Analytics. As a Business Intelligence Analyst Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to provide valuable insights into user behavior, their product usage patterns, and identifying opportunities for growth. You will help create dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to the stakeholders. Furthermore, you will use your expertise in creating and editing visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, and transforming data sets into visually compelling visuals. You will also provide visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with teams to understand business needs and requirements for data analysis
  • Design and develop data models, dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders
  • Create and edit visual content, including maps, charts, and graphs, to provide visual representations of data insights
  • Transform quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals that effectively communicate important information
  • Use advanced statistical techniques to analyze and interpret complex datasets
  • Provide expert-level visual, technical, and editorial guidance to ensure the highest quality of data visualizations
  • Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data visualization needs and provide recommendations on the most effective visual representation of data
  • Conduct quality checks on visual content to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to brand guidelines
  • Communicate complex data insights through visually compelling presentations and reports, tailored to different audiences

Minimum Requirements

  • Bachelor's/ Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role
  • Expertise in statistical analysis, data modelling, and data visualisation
  • Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js
  • Experience working with large datasets and proficiency in SQL
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
  • Samples / examples showcasing previous data analysis and visualization projects

Title: Inventory Data Analyst
Description:
Leavitt Machinery‚ÄØis one of the fastest growing material handling equipment dealerships in North America. With an entrepreneurial spirit, mission-driven approach, and customer-focused mindset, Leavitt has achieved consistent growth over the past 25 years.

Leavitt Machinery is now an integral entity within the Venturis group of companies, an integrated and expanding network of businesses, including over 60+ branches and 1400+ employees across Canada and the USA. Venturis Capital strategically invests in visionary and values-driven organizations, with expertise in the material handling equipment industry.

In addition to our expanding dealership network, the Venturis portfolio includes complementary companies providing financing, freight and logistics, parts manufacturing, industrial parts supply, component rebuilding, training solutions, and marketing.

With a focus on learning and continuous improvement, we are proud to invest in our people and offer a progressive and flexible work culture where you can develop and advance your career while focusing on meaningful work.

The Opportunity

Leavitt Machinery is looking for an Inventory Data Analyst to join our team in Coquitlam, BC. As the Inventory Data Analyst, you will partner with stakeholders to ensure their needs are met by the Parts department, while capitalizing on opportunities to drive business success.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

As the Inventory Data Analyst your key responsibilities will include:


Manage and monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal inventory
Conduct periodic inventory audits to ensure accuracy
Perform cycle counts and reconcile discrepancies
Coordinate and support annual count of all inventories
Analyze inventory data to identify trends, forecast needs, and optimize inventory levels
Generate and present reports on inventory levels, usage rates, and forecasted needs
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory management
Use historical data to identify demand patterns and adjust inventory levels accordingly
Work with Sales and Operations teams to understand future demand and plan inventory needs
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance inventory management efficiency
Leverage inventory management software and other technologies to streamline operations
Analyze inventory-related costs and identify areas for cost reduction
Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards
Maintain safe inventory storage practices and ensure adherence to safety standards
Provide support to internal teams by ensuring the availability of required parts
Ensure all inventory-related documentation is complete and accurate


Required Skills & Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills, knowledge, and competencies:


Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, business administration, or a related field preferred
Prior experience in inventory management or a related field
Familiarization with Lean concepts & principles will be considered a strong asset
Previous experience with Microsoft Dynamics ERP is considered an asset
Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros, and data visualization
Experience with tools such as SQL, Tableau, and Power BI for creating detailed reports
Excellent communication skills, organizational skills, and analytical skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities in parallel and excel in a fast-paced work environment
High level of accuracy and attention to detail


Benefits & Perks

Leavitt Machinery Canada is proud to offer competitive compensation and flexible benefits coverage for all eligible employees, including an employer matching RRSP plan:


Company paid medical health care plan for you and your dependents
Extended health plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Dental plan, vision plan, and prescription drug coverage
Annual health care spending account
Life insurance, disability insurance, and travel insurance ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Sick leave plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Employee assistance programs
RRSP matching
Wellness days
Ongoing professional development opportunities


The base pay range for this role is: $50,000-$70,000 annually, depending on experience.

This is an onsite role based in Coquitlam, BC.

Leavitt Machinery & Venturis would like to thank all applicants for their interest, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an interview. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

#LeavittMachinery

Title: Data Analyst (Collibra)
Description:
Data Analyst (Collibra)




Summary

The Data Analyst will be responsible for leveraging Collibra, our primary data governance tool, to connect to various databases and build comprehensive data lineages. This role requires a deep understanding of data governance principles, database management, and the ability to translate complex data processes into clear, actionable insights.




Length: 6 month contract (high likelihood of extension)

Associate Vendors: We are accepting applications from candidates who are currently authorized to work in the US or Canada for any employer without sponsorship.




Role & Responsibilities

Utilize Collibra to create and maintain detailed data lineages, mapping data flow across various systems and ensuring traceability from source to destination.
Configure and optimize Collibra to meet organizational data governance needs, including setting up data policies, definitions, and stewardship workflows.
Connect Collibra with different databases and data sources, ensuring accurate integration and synchronization of data.
Collaborate with data owners and stakeholders to validate data quality, identify discrepancies, and implement corrective actions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation of data governance processes and data lineage maps. Generate and present reports on data governance metrics and compliance.




Required Qualifications

Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong focus on data governance and data lineage.
Proven experience working with Collibra, including configuration, data lineage mapping, and integration with various databases.
Proficiency in SQL for querying databases, experience with data modeling, and understanding of data governance frameworks.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.




Desired Qualifications

Experience with other data governance tools or platforms.
Knowledge of data privacy regulations and compliance standards.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.




How Do I Apply?

Apply on this website or send an updated resume to recruiters@prolianceconsult.com.




Proliance Consulting provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Proliance Consulting complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfers, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Data Analyst (Street Operations)
Description:
Requisition ID: 41849

Organization

Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the x ∑m…ôŒ∏k ∑…ôyÃì…ôm (Musqueam), S·∏µwxÃ±w√∫7mesh (Squamish), and s…ôlilw…ôta…¨ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world‚Äôs most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, reconciliation, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

Main Purpose & Function

This position is responsible for providing technical oversight of Street Operations data collection for street and sidewalk infrastructure maintenance and repair programs and ensuring that data is maintained in accordance with best practices. This position performs highly complex data analysis using large data sets and produces visualization, reports and summaries related to expenditures, schedules and accomplishments, using modern business intelligence (BI) tools.

The Data Specialist supports asset maintenance and repair programs for streets, sidewalks, and structures in accordance with best practices including: analysis of large data sets related to pavement, sidewalks and structures, analysis of capital, operating, repair and maintenance costs for various asset types, and review of asset management data sets to inform maintenance and repair programs.

The position reports to the Superintendent I ‚Äì Cuts, Utilities & Operations Administration, and works collaboratively with senior leadership to support decision making for the branch. This position also liaises with Streets Design, Finance, Risk Management and other Engineering branches.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities


Manages the ongoing operation and maintenance of data and related data infrastructure to meet the data analytics and reporting needs of the Streets Operations Branch.
Leads, consults, and participates in business process and technology reviews of all Street Operations functions recommending solutions and alternatives related to the accessibility, interaction, and presentation of data.
Leads the development of Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting platform for Street Operations.
Designs and implements sustainable and repeatable data management approaches involving cloud, on-premise, and big data datasets and technologies.
Develops and maintains large data sets pertaining to spending, cut repairs, work accomplishments, 311 citizen complaints, equipment, etc. from multiple City of Vancouver sources including but not limited to SAP, Hansen and SEAM.
Designs and develops reports, visualizations, and dashboards for tracking KPIs, metrics and service levels using advanced Excel, GIS Software, and modern BI tools for presentation at the branch, divisional, and department level, as well as to external stakeholders.
Recommends solutions and alternatives related to the accessibility, interaction, and presentation of data.
Identifies implications and makes recommendations for changes in data processes and procedures that may affect operational areas.
Collects and analyzes data to complete current state analyses and to optimize solutions.
Processes data sets for quality assurance and following up for corrective action where required.
Builds financial models that accurately project the annual cost recovery rates required to balance expenses such as equipment and fleet.
Collaborates with broad, multi-functional project teams to maintain clarity of objectives and alignment on implementation plans.
Manage data requests from internal and external stakeholders including other Engineering Services branches, 311, Risk Management, Freedom of Information, and Legal Services.
Teaches, mentors and supports administrative staff in the application of best practice approaches to data input and administration to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Directs and reviews the data collection work of manual data collection efforts.
Other duties/responsibilities as assigned.


Qualifications

Education and Experience:


Completion of a post-secondary degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Business Administration, Business Analytics or related field of study plus considerable experience in data analysis, business process and/or performance improvement in a public sector or large multi stakeholder organization or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities


Strong knowledge of Microsoft Power BI, Dataflows, Power BI Service and paginated reports.
Sound knowledge of structured operational business processes.
Working knowledge of could and on-premise warehouses and query systems.
Advanced in the use of Microsoft Excel and office suite with excellent keyboarding skills
Analytical skills, accuracy and attention to detail with a strong sense of accountability.
Skilled in the use of data systems and statistical data collection.
Excellent business writing skills.
Ability to analyze and synthesize data from multiple data sources and formats.
Ability to work with query languages (SQL, MDX, etc.)
Ability to design and build data warehouses and data marts.
Ability to problem solve and provide creative ways to resolve issues.
Ability to communicate effectively, foster high standards, and deliver results in a fast-paced, performance focussed environment.
Ability to work under pressure, manage multiple priorities and respond to requests in a timely manner.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal and external contacts and team members to provide advice, information, and mentoring.
Ability to demonstrate an organized and local approach to finding solutions to complex situations or problems.


Business Unit/Department: Engineering Services (1300)

Affiliation: CUPE 15 Non Pks

Employment Type: Temporary Full Time

Position Start Date: September, 2024

Position End Date: July, 2026

Salary Information: Pay Grade GR-024: $42.04 to $49.65 per hour

Application Close: August 9, 2024

At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Indigenous peoples, people of colour, 2SLGBTQ+ persons including all genders and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Before you click Apply now

Once you start your application you can save your work and leave the applications page, however please remember to submit your profile to the specific job requisition before the posting closing date.

In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process may include answering application questions related to the preferred requirements of the role which may take approx. 5-10 minutes. Cover letters should express interest and highlight additional information relevant to the position and resumes should include a summary of skills and experience related to the position.

Requisition ID: 41849

Organization

Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the x ∑m…ôŒ∏k ∑…ôyÃì…ôm (Musqueam), S·∏µwxÃ±w√∫7mesh (Squamish), and s…ôlilw…ôta…¨ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world‚Äôs most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, reconciliation, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

Main Purpose & Function

This position is responsible for providing technical oversight of Street Operations data collection for street and sidewalk infrastructure maintenance and repair programs and ensuring that data is maintained in accordance with best practices. This position performs highly complex data analysis using large data sets and produces visualization, reports and summaries related to expenditures, schedules and accomplishments, using modern business intelligence (BI) tools.

The Data Specialist supports asset maintenance and repair programs for streets, sidewalks, and structures in accordance with best practices including: analysis of large data sets related to pavement, sidewalks and structures, analysis of capital, operating, repair and maintenance costs for various asset types, and review of asset management data sets to inform maintenance and repair programs.

The position reports to the Superintendent I ‚Äì Cuts, Utilities & Operations Administration, and works collaboratively with senior leadership to support decision making for the branch. This position also liaises with Streets Design, Finance, Risk Management and other Engineering branches.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities

  • Manages the ongoing operation and maintenance of data and related data infrastructure to meet the data analytics and reporting needs of the Streets Operations Branch.
  • Leads, consults, and participates in business process and technology reviews of all Street Operations functions recommending solutions and alternatives related to the accessibility, interaction, and presentation of data.
  • Leads the development of Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting platform for Street Operations.
  • Designs and implements sustainable and repeatable data management approaches involving cloud, on-premise, and big data datasets and technologies.
  • Develops and maintains large data sets pertaining to spending, cut repairs, work accomplishments, 311 citizen complaints, equipment, etc. from multiple City of Vancouver sources including but not limited to SAP, Hansen and SEAM.
  • Designs and develops reports, visualizations, and dashboards for tracking KPIs, metrics and service levels using advanced Excel, GIS Software, and modern BI tools for presentation at the branch, divisional, and department level, as well as to external stakeholders.
  • Recommends solutions and alternatives related to the accessibility, interaction, and presentation of data.
  • Identifies implications and makes recommendations for changes in data processes and procedures that may affect operational areas.
  • Collects and analyzes data to complete current state analyses and to optimize solutions.
  • Processes data sets for quality assurance and following up for corrective action where required.
  • Builds financial models that accurately project the annual cost recovery rates required to balance expenses such as equipment and fleet.
  • Collaborates with broad, multi-functional project teams to maintain clarity of objectives and alignment on implementation plans.
  • Manage data requests from internal and external stakeholders including other Engineering Services branches, 311, Risk Management, Freedom of Information, and Legal Services.
  • Teaches, mentors and supports administrative staff in the application of best practice approaches to data input and administration to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
  • Directs and reviews the data collection work of manual data collection efforts.
  • Other duties/responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:

  • Completion of a post-secondary degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in Business Administration, Business Analytics or related field of study plus considerable experience in data analysis, business process and/or performance improvement in a public sector or large multi stakeholder organization or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Power BI, Dataflows, Power BI Service and paginated reports.
  • Sound knowledge of structured operational business processes.
  • Working knowledge of could and on-premise warehouses and query systems.
  • Advanced in the use of Microsoft Excel and office suite with excellent keyboarding skills
  • Analytical skills, accuracy and attention to detail with a strong sense of accountability.
  • Skilled in the use of data systems and statistical data collection.
  • Excellent business writing skills.
  • Ability to analyze and synthesize data from multiple data sources and formats.
  • Ability to work with query languages (SQL, MDX, etc.)
  • Ability to design and build data warehouses and data marts.
  • Ability to problem solve and provide creative ways to resolve issues.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, foster high standards, and deliver results in a fast-paced, performance focussed environment.
  • Ability to work under pressure, manage multiple priorities and respond to requests in a timely manner.
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of internal and external contacts and team members to provide advice, information, and mentoring.
  • Ability to demonstrate an organized and local approach to finding solutions to complex situations or problems.

Business Unit/Department: Engineering Services (1300)

Affiliation: CUPE 15 Non Pks

Employment Type: Temporary Full Time

Position Start Date: September, 2024

Position End Date: July, 2026

Salary Information: Pay Grade GR-024: $42.04 to $49.65 per hour

Application Close: August 9, 2024

At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Indigenous peoples, people of colour, 2SLGBTQ+ persons including all genders and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Before you click Apply now

Once you start your application you can save your work and leave the applications page, however please remember to submit your profile to the specific job requisition before the posting closing date.

In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process may include answering application questions related to the preferred requirements of the role which may take approx. 5-10 minutes. Cover letters should express interest and highlight additional information relevant to the position and resumes should include a summary of skills and experience related to the position.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Salary range

The salary range for this position is CAD $38.12 - $54.80 / hour

Come work with us!

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka‚Äôpamux Nations,and is home to six M√©tis Chartered Communities.

Our team of nearly 45,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care. Learn more.

We are currently looking to fill a Full Time opportunity for a Data Analyst at Central City Tower located in Surrey, BC.

Come work with us!

Joining the Fraser Health team offers you opportunities to work in a rapidly growing organization with health professionals who are excellent in their respective fields, career growth and advancement, a competitive compensation package (including four weeks of vacation to start, comprehensive health benefits, and pension plan), and the rewarding opportunity to make a difference every single day in health care.

Fraser Health values diversity in the work force and strives to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring and Trust. Fraser Health‚Äôs hiring practices aspire to ensure all individuals are treated in an inclusive, equitable, and culturally safe manner.

Connect with us!

Connect with us on our Careers social channels where you‚Äôll learn about exciting opportunities, get career tips from our recruiters, and meet some of your future team members! You can also visit us on Indeed and Glassdoor.

Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | X

Detailed Overview

Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for providing data management and analytical support for population and public health surveillance and health assessment functions of the Population Health Observatory. The Data Analyst is a key member of the Population Health Observatory. This Unit directly supports the work of Population and Public Health and other Fraser Health program areas. The Analyst has health authority-wide responsibilities in the area of data collection and synthesis, analysis, interpretation, knowledge translation, and dissemination.

Responsibilities


Assists in the creation, synthesis, and dissemination of population health information to Fraser Health stakeholders for planning and decision-making. Contributes to publications informing population health issues for use by Medical Health Officers and Senior Leadership, Managers, and healthcare providers as well as for use by external partners and for public information.
Performs qualitative and quantitative data analysis using descriptive and statistical methodologies, including use of statistical software (e.g. R, SAS).
Uses GIS software to create, organize and maintain geographic maps; uses cartography, geoprocessing, geocoding, vector and raster mapping, spatial joining, spatial editing, and Python and VBScript coding to conduct geospatial data analysis and create GIS maps; maintains appropriate metadata and documentation to describe maps, spatial analyses and processes and shapefiles; uses GIS maps, geospatial analysis, and spatial epidemiology of disease and its risk factors to assist in public health planning and evaluation, disease surveillance, outbreak investigations, and emergency preparedness.
Supports data collection, analyzes data, interprets results, and prepares regular surveillance reports related but not limited to communicable diseases, chronic conditions, and other adverse health outcomes in populations.
Provides technical advice to the communicable disease nurses, coordinators, and other members of the Public Health and Health Protection teams on data collection, cleaning and analysis to ensure consistency and validity of data.
Participates in the identification and resolution of data quality issues, including identifying and reporting data quality issues, analyzing issues, recommending improvements and implementing new/revised processes. Promotes the use of best practices in data management and data quality.
Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, data cleaning and documentation; develops and maintains data collection and storage systems such as databases and spreadsheets, including designing ad hoc reports; automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools including structured query language (SQL); partners with relevant stakeholders to ensure reporting needs are met for assigned databases.
Identifies and collates population health data from local, regional, and provincial sources.
Works collaboratively with relevant program areas to develop project specific tools and support monitoring and evaluation activities.
Responds to requests for information by performing duties such as extracting, linking, manipulating, analyzing, and summarizing data at the request of internal and external partners. Prepares appropriate communications to stakeholders including reports, oral presentations, written communications suitable for a variety of audiences, and online communication formats.
Fosters and maintains positive, collaborative, and effective interdisciplinary working relationships with Fraser Health internal partners, other health authorities, and provincial partners.
Prepares and maintains supporting documentation such as user guides, data collection procedure manuals, data security policies, and data dictionaries.
Supports system development, enhancement, and maintenance by performing duties such as evaluating existing and emerging data systems and recommend strategies to deliver analytics in an accurate, timely and user-friendly manner.
Maintains current knowledge and technical skills necessary to work effectively as a Data Analyst.
Performs other related duties as assigned.


Qualifications

Education and Experience

Master's degree in Epidemiology, Public Health, Biostatistics, Health Informatics, Health Sciences or other related discipline, plus three (3) years of recent, related technical experience in data management, linkage, analysis, interpretation, and reporting, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

Competencies

Demonstrates the leadership practices of the Fraser Health Leadership Framework of Clear, Caring and Courageous and creates the conditions for people to succeed.

Professional/Technical Capabilities:


Understanding of basic epidemiology and public health surveillance systems.
Knowledge of health data sources and data quality issues.
Demonstrated analytical and statistical skills including ability to find, collect, analyze, and interpret data, use basic statistical concepts, and prepare written reports.
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary, dynamic environment as part of a collaborative and high-functioning team. Foster effective working relationships that promote cooperative goal achievement and contribute to an atmosphere of trust and mutual respect.
Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues to share and develop resources, knowledge and skills in order to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of assessment and surveillance functions.
Demonstrated knowledge of statistical, data management, and data visualization software systems (GIS, R, SAS, SQL, Tableau, Power BI).
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.

Title: Data Analyst - Remote Work (Website Design Valley)
Description:
About Us

Website Design Valley is a premier web design and development company dedicated to delivering innovative digital solutions. We specialize in creating high-quality websites and comprehensive digital strategies for our clients. As we continue to expand, we are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our remote team.

Job Description

We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to help us interpret and utilize data to drive informed business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, a passion for technology, and the ability to work effectively in a remote team environment.

Key Responsibilities

Collect, organize, and analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights.

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).

Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to support strategic decision-making.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.

Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify opportunities and trends.

Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular audits and validation processes.

Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques.

Qualifications

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.

Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel.

Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote work environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in the web design and development industry.

Knowledge of machine learning and predictive analytics.

Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.

Understanding of marketing analytics and customer segmentation.

What We Offer

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Flexible working hours and remote work environment.

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Collaborative and inclusive company culture.

Health, dental, and vision insurance.

Generous paid time off and holidays.

Hourly pay rate: $30 - $40 CAD per hour, depending on experience and qualifications.

How To Apply

If you are passionate about data analysis and excited about working in a dynamic and innovative environment, we would love to hear from you! Please apply!

Website Design Valley is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Value

Title: Data Centre Analyst
Description:
Marketing Statement

A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.

At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We‚Äôre committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!

Summary

Responsibilities

The Data Centre Analyst (DCA) monitors and maintains the performance of the technical operations of all data centre facilities across the enterprise. Plans, schedules and executes the daily operational activities for all enterprise facilities ranging from the Data Centre to communication closets. Monitors and maintains the operational aspects of the enterprise backup system. Develops and maintains detailed documentation in support of the operation of the Data Centre.

Mitigates operational and system risk in support of enterprise risk management. Ensures the monitoring and analysis of Data Centre infrastructure statistical data. Plans and schedules the Data Centre infrastructure replacement lifecycle. Develops and refines Data Centre practices to follow accepted best practices.

Duties And Responsibilities

Plans, schedules and executes the daily operational activities for all enterprise facilities ranging from the Data Centre to communication closets. These activities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Analyzes the ongoing performance of the Data Centre infrastructure including servers, storage and supporting systems ensuring that the components are running at optimal levels,

Analyzes system power and cooling requirements at all sites and develop plans to increase the efficiency of those sites through a reduction in the consumption of both power and cooling,

Handles the support call lifecycle with infrastructure vendors in support of both component failures and analysis indicating component performance issues,

Provides expertise in the process of racking of network equipment, servers and storage according to data centre best practices.

Monitors and maintains the operational aspects of the enterprise backup system by:

Analyzing schedule policies and making adjustments to backup windows as needed relative to the requirements of the business,

Recommending best practices and advancements that support the current IT strategy,

Monitoring system health and daily backup jobs, on-demand restores of business data and the configuration of agents on computer systems.

Develops and maintains detailed documentation in support of the operation of the Data Centre.

Documentation includes run books for all infrastructure components describing period maintenance activities, standard operating procedures and system configurations.

Mitigates Operational And System Risk By

Analyzing operating system patches and system and storage firmware upgrades in support of enterprise risk management,

Planning and scheduling firmware upgrades and operating system patches with input from other BT teams to mitigate identified risks and within the parameters of the enterprise change management process,

Planning, scheduling and executing the testing of infrastructure components in collaboration with other enterprise teams.

Ensures the monitoring and analysis of Data Centre infrastructure as follows:

Develops infrastructure capacity monitoring programs to provide accurate forecasting and planning information,

Analyzes and establishes KPIs to provide accurate dashboard information,

Monitors enterprise resource consumption and develops trending analysis for storage and servers,

Monitors power and cooling and analyzes consumption trends for dashboard reporting,

Summarizes status providing monthly dashboard reporting including, but not limited to, power and cooling usage and infrastructure capacities.

Plans and schedules the Data Centre infrastructure replacement lifecycle as follows:

Remains current on technology roadmaps and makes recommendations to the IT Operations management team related to the infrastructure replacement program,

Plans and schedules the introduction of new infrastructure into the Data Centre to review the changing technologies and determine suitability in the enterprise environment,

Plans the configuration of infrastructure components for the enterprise procurement process,

Ensures assets, including racks, servers, storage, appliances and cabling are accurately recorded in the current asset management system,

Tracks and monitors the infrastructure equipment through the current asset management system.

Develops And Refines Data Centre Practices As Follows

Reviews current processes and procedures, identifies limitations, recommends and implements improvements,

Ensures the enterprise remains current on best practices and trends in data centre management,

Creates, reviews and maintains documentation in support of data centre good practices.

Performs related duties as assigned, such being items of a minor nature that do not affect the value of the job.

Qualifications

Requires a diploma in computing and information technology from a recognized institute of technology, specializing in network configuration and administration, and computer hardware systems.

Requires three (3) years previous experience in an information technology environment involving the installation, troubleshooting and support of corporate network and hardware systems, including one (1) year in a Data Centre environment supporting relevant power management, cooling and operation specific systems.

A further period of up to one (1) year on the job is required to become thoroughly familiar with the enterprise architecture plan, IS policies and standards, the enterprise Data Centre and specific network and hardware components.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

Salary $7,977 - $9,593 per month (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: July 31, 2024

Closing Date: Open until filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

TransLink is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.
